Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dsrtdsl
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. My family and I (wife and 3 young children) had the unfortunate luck of visiting New Orleans during Hurricane Isaac. Upon check-in, they gave us a room on a high floor and away from the elevator just as we had requested prior to our arrival. They even gave us a two room suite so our children had their own seperate area to sleep, watch television, and play! The room was absolutely fantastic! It was clean and well appointed (microwave, refrigerator, sink, two flat screen televisions, etc.). The staff during check-in was absolutely fantastic. They gave us a map of the area, recommended points of interest for the family, and made excellent restaurant recommendations (everything was within walking distance, even with my 2-year old in tow). The breakfast provided every morning was more than enough for my family. It included made-to-order waffles, eggs, sausage, bacon, grits, muffins, danishes, cereal, and more. Hurricane Isaac hit during our second day at the hotel. The entire staff was more than accommodating during the storm. They continued to check on our family to ensure we were not in need of anything (food, water, blankets, etc.). Miss Janelle even loaned us her personal DVD player in order for my children to watch movies and keep occupied during the storm! There wasn't a day that went by that my family wasn't greeted by every staff member when they saw us. The General Manager (Mr. Stanley) was even at the hotel and very involved in the day-to-day activities. It was absolutely fantastic to see the General Manager of an establishment so involved with his customers. My family had to extend our stay by two nights due to the hurricane, and, not one time, was there a problem making sure we were safe and had the proper accommodations. The entire staff at the Quality Inn & Suites in downtown New Orleans treated us like family during our entire stay. I will stay at this establishment everytime I visit New Orleans in the future, and I recommend to anybody looking for a home away from home to stay at the Quality Inn & Suites in downtown New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mgi1983
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to take a weekend trip to New Orleans, and she had been there multiple times, staying at Le Pavillion and other high end hotels. She mentioned the Quality Inn and that the service there was outstanding. Although a bit hesitant, I went along with it. My concerns quickly vanished. We drove all night and didn't plan well, so we arrived about 3 hours before standard check in time. The staff was almost apologetic and took the blame when they said our room was not ready yet, but would be within an hour. (Still two hours before standard check-in). We grabbed a bite to eat, came back and not only was the room ready, but we had been upgraded to a suite for our troubles. Uhh, what troubles? Getting there way too early was our fault, but I'll take it! So we get a suite, before we go up, the bellboy gives us a map of the french quarter and where all to go. The room may not be a Ritz Carlton suite but it did the job for us. A king sized bed, flat screen TV, couch, fridge, microwave, desk, nice sized bathroom. I mean really, what else do you need? The location is great. It's just a few blocks from Bourbon street and if you ever want to get sleep at night, don't get a room on Bourbon. It's also just a short walk from the Riverwalk, and all kinds of touristy stuff. So more about the service. One night we were hungry and felt like being lazy so we called down to the front desk to see what restaurants delivered. The answer: A lot. The night desk clerk pulled a large box from under the desk with about 100 menus inside. He told us what he thought was good and didn't steer us wrong. One day we wanted to go to a Saints game and found tickets online. Only problem: No printer. We called down again and the desk clerk let us use their printer. It is a bit pricey to use their garage to park your car but worth it. Again, valets are extremely courteous. Basically, it seems they will bend over backwards to make sure you have a pleasant stay with everything you would need. Stay here. It's really worth it and costs half what most hotels in the area do.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, average stay”
Reviews.Author: cantravellor
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this hotel 3.5 stars. This is by no means a luxary hotel but it is a good place to stay if you're on a budget and want to be in walking distance of French quarter. The hotel is old and in need of an update both inside and out (but then it would probably cost more) but it is very clean. It is also a basic hotel with no bells or whistles but it does have a small workout room that was clean and functional. Breakfast is free and quite typical of most free breakfasts with a few hot items and continental items. I found this breakfast to have less options than other hotels and the quality of food was also worse; however it's free. Room was dark but was nicely laid out with our room and kids' room seperate with bathroom in middle which gave privacy. Service was fine - no issues, staff friendly. There is also a safe in room which we like to lock up passports. Surrounding neighbourhood is a little gritty but never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Lkpom
Reviews.Content: My rating is more like 3 and a half stars. It was a fine room, good/friendly service, etc. Room smelled strongly of musk/smoke, which was annoying, since it was a no smoking room. Bathroom was small, and there weren't enough mirrors around. Good location to get to French Quarter. It was difficult at first to check in, because there were cars in front of the hotel and we had to wait for one to move. Parking was expensive, but that's hard to get around. Would have liked the place to be a little cheaper, but it was perfectly fine for one night. If I was staying in NOLA any longer then that, I probably would have splurged a little more and stayed somewhere a little closer to the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “This Quality Inn Staff is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Asikdar
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter (who was moving to NOLA with a new job) booked this hotel from the road because of its location and price. Now they cannot stop saying enough good things about their stay at this place. At first they did not know how many nights they would be staying (it ended up being 8 nights). After the movers arrived with my daughter's stuff, one new white pant suit had been damaged. Someone on the staff offered to take it to the local dry cleaner and then the manager, Mr. Stanley, kept at it till the problem (which the hotel obviously had nothing to do with) was resolved. Seriously, where do you get this kind of service these days? My family said the complimentary daily breakfast served was terrific and varied. The entire staff was outstanding. Now that our daughter has moved to NOLA, this hotel has won our stay during future visits for a long, long time to come. With a manager and staff of this caliber, no wonder so many of the reviews mention the staff as being so helpful and caring. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “a good time in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: angieleppert
Reviews.Content: me and my daughter went on a seven day cruise.we stay the night before going on cruise and the staff was so helpful and nice . they made us feel welcome and took good care of us. we also left our car in there care,we came back that sunday and stayed another night,they had us already,we had good time in neworleans

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: triems05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while on a road trip with our 3 yr old and 9 month old. We were very comfortable with the space we had in the room, the cleanliness and the safety of the area. It was an easy walk to the French Quarter. The staff was very good and the breakfast was good. The price is decent for what you get. It's quiet - even on the weekend nights. Be prepared to tip the "bell hops" and the valets, on top of the nightly charge to park. Or, you could find your own overnight parking. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MowerManZ71
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend in NOLA for The Brothers of the Sun concert. My wife and I really enjoyed the friendliness of the staff, the location and the accommodations. It is rated very high on here for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay With Welcoming Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Prohoteltraveler16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for a weekend and we had a great time! At first we were a little weary about being away from the French quarter but when we arrived we came to find it to be less than a 5 min walk. The staff was great! They were so pleasant from the moment we checked in till check out. They went out of their way to help us in many ways and we really felt at home here! I recommend this hotel to anyone who really expects a great southern experience with southern hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Price and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have been to New Orleans and have stayed here twice. Both times they were filming a movie outside of the hotel which made it interesting. Mr Stanly and his team are professional and helpful, the location is very good for the French Quarter. If ever we do return I know where I'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - great price!”
Reviews.Author: HartDesign
Reviews.Content: Downtown hotel prices are usually too high for our budget. The Quality Inn on O'Keefe Ave. was a real find! Super clean and comfortable, but the very best part of our stay was the STAFF. Genuinely friendly, attentive, and anticipated our every need. The hotel location can make baggage unloading/loading, parking, and car retreival challenging because they do not have an off-street area. But they were right there to help with everything and our 6-day stay was relaxed and fun. We will stay here again - and we do plan to visit again - New Orleans is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “These guys do it right!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrmotyl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my first stop on a two week road trip to visit my family and we only stayed at hotels in the "choice hotels" family. This one was BY FAR the BEST. I can't describe the level of service and hospitality staff provided us from the moment we arrived to the time we left. We arrived 2 hours before check-in because we wanted to explore New Orleans and they were soooo accommodating. They were able to get us one of our 2 rooms straight away and held our bags or the 2nd room, all while being so apologetic about not having a 2nd room available even though they weren't required to. At least two staff members helped us with recommendations and the layout of the city. I was most impressed with the gentleman who helped us with our bags. Not only did he take of our family of 6 bags, he also sat down with us and provided us with a "his special map" of the town. He sat down with us and hi-lighted places to go, eat and see. They could not have been nicer. The hotel itself was a short walk to Bourbon street and the French quarter, which was ideal. There was secured garage parking a block away that was reasonable priced. The amenities at the hotel were great, the room was impeccable and the hot breakfast was perfect. This is the only hotel I will stay at or recommend in New Orleans. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: RTWTripping
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent (far enough away from the partying but close enough to the partying!) and the staff are super-friendly and always willing to help in any way. We stayed in a fantastic room (suite) and it was very quiet. We got a perfect night's sleep every night. The room was clean and comfy. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are misleading for what we got.”
Reviews.Author: danogolf
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I thought I was in the wrong place. Maybe some rooms are remodeled and we got an old one? There was mold in the bathroom, bathroom floor was dirty, there was hair on the towels, one of the TV's was not working and some stains on the comforters. The staff was nice and the location was 5 blocks from French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Essence Music Festival”
Reviews.Author: Karensslove
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and willing to go the extra mile when it comes to their guest. The breakfast was freshly made and it tasted so good. I would not change 1 thing about this hotel it was really a nice place to stay. Really close to Burbon and the Superdome. Staff are the friendlist.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: socialboot
Reviews.Content: Excellent and accommodating staff. The room was in great shape and the service was as well. All for a not insane price.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable room for a night.”
Reviews.Author: MikeandRoseStefka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on June 26, 2012. for one night, We arrived at 3:10 pm, just after check in time. Our room was not ready, but by the time we checked in and parked the car in the garage, an upgrade to a suite was available, so they gave us that instead with no extra charge. The elevator ride up to the room was hot, but the elevator was quick. The accomodations for the room were quite comfortable, and were very clean. The A/C in the room worked fine, as it was approaching 100 F outside, and was a comfortable 72 F in the room. The free breakfast in the morning was a nice touch, with eggs, bacon , waffles , grits, and coffee, orange juice and milk, with various other " continental " additions, in a buffet style. Was about a 4-5 block walk to the French Quarter, and about a 6 Block walk to the Superdome / New Orleans Arena complex, which was very convenient also. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Josh H
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from front desk and bell staff. Very knowledgable abut the area and recommended places to go. Only complaint is that the bed was extremely hard, making it difficult to rest after a long day/night out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay yet!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany T
Reviews.Content: Stay here! The staff are top notch, it is very close to the French Quarter, but far away enough that you can have some quiet. The room we booked was upgraded (without us asking) for us and we stayed in a mini Suite with kitchenette, sitting area, bedroom area, both with flat screens and cable t.v. The breakfast was more than adequate, and the space very clean! Although it isn't an "updated" hotel, we were so comfortable there that we will always stay there when in New Orleans. Best part about it is they are not even aware of their #3 ranking of the best hotels in New Orleans (out of 148!) and were so humble to find out! Stan (the manager) greeted us by name EVERY time he saw us and made us feel at home! Kudos to the Quality Inn, it was well worth every penny spent!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to book a room here for Halloween weekend end October 2011, and even luckier when we were upgraded to a small suite on arrival. The hotel is right on the border of downtown New Orleans and the French Quarter. It was just perfect for the Halloween celebrations. The hotel is close to streetcar stops and other means of public transit, or for walking around in the historic areas. We also felt safe at night. The complementary breakfast was more than sufficient, juices, waffles, eggs, cereal. The staff were always courteous and friendly, always ready to help us. We received great advice on attractions and good restaurants. I cannot recommend highly enough this hotel or the staff who run it. Great rates, great location, wonderful staff. A great stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KLESmyth
Reviews.Content: We arrived via Amtrak - who were late as per usual - and were greeted with smiling faces and prompt service. Checked in, upgraded and shown to our room/s within 15mins of walking through the front door, how much better can you get? All within a 10min walk of the famous French Quarter, all the sights, sounds and spectacles without the noise and hustle and bustle for when you want to rest. The complimentary breakfast was much more than we expected, juices, waffles, eggs, cereal, all you could want really. Again the staff were friendly and warm, nothing was too much trouble. Several times we were asked if we needed help finding tours or other attractions, we were never left feeling as though we didn't exist or weren't valued. Cannot recommend highly enough this hotel or the staff who run it. Thank you very much for such a great stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: heyjudy51
Reviews.Content: The customer service was exceptional. It is an older hotel but in very good condition with lots of charm & character. We were upgraded to a mini suite which was on the corner with a great view of the bustling downtown area. We walked to French Quarter & Riverwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug81
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the Quality Inn & Suites Downtown. We arrived late to the hotel and the manager on duty upgraded us from the double room we had booked to the queen suite. Sweet! The room was spacious with two TVs (one in the bedroom and another in the sitting area), a small couch and chair as well as a fridge, sink and iron and ironing board. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The shower had good pressure. The bed itself was comfortable, no complaints about bad sleep. There was no view but we also weren't in the hotel often anyway. The room and the hotel was very quiet. WiFi is available and the connection is on and off, but mostly sufficient if one just wants to check e-mail, etc. The staff at the hotel are super nice and attentive. When we were leaving, we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel until later in the day, and the staff called the taxi for us, which was waiting when we returned to leave for the airport. Breakfast at the hotel is complementary with the room - it's fairly basic and rudimentary (plastic plates, cups and utensils), but sufficient and serves the purpose. The location of the hotel is not perfect (perfect would be inside the French Quarter), but it's very close - about 7-8 min walk to Bourbon Street and the rest of the French Quarter. It was also safe at night - at no point did we feel unsafe. I would highly recommend this hotel, it's nothing fancy but it's more than sufficient if one is looking for a comfortable clean place to sleep that is close to all the attractions and won't break the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Matthew A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the border of downtown New Orleans and the French Quarter. It is one block from Canal Street, and two blocks away from the French Quarter (Bourbon St). The hotel is in a perfect location for streetcar stops and other means of public transit. The area is safe and quiet at night. My girlfriend and I had no reservations walking around at night. All the employees are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean, and there is a small continental breakfast available in the morning. If you don't mind an easy 5 minute walk to get to the French Quarter, this is the place to stay. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing, great location”
Reviews.Author: kerh22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few blocks from all of the action so it is very quiet and we slept great. Staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to receive an upgrade to our room when we checked in. Roomy area and plenty to chose from for breakfast. Decor is a little dated but the facility and rooms were very clean and the mattress was very comfortable. My only complaint would be that the pillows are pretty flat, probably would benefit from some new ones.

Reviews.Title: “Not the newest, but the nicest and cleanest.”
Reviews.Author: mcmadnes
Reviews.Content: Everyone that works here is aces! My room was clean and comfortable. It does need some renovation, which I am told is underway. By no means is it seedy, it just needs a more updated look. It's 3 blocks from Bourbon Street and one block off Canal Street. The difference is noise level is huge. There is a Subway sandwich shop right next to the hotel for late night snacking and the hotel itself has continental breakfast that is delicious. I am planning another trip to New Orleans and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe The Ratings On Trip Advisor Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Tommy052
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for hotels in new orleans, and after booking and canceling 2 hotels after reading the reviews on trip advisor. I read the great reviews on Quality Inn and Suites and decided to book there. The ratings were dead on the staff was friendly and treated you as if you were in a 5 star resort. the rooms were clean and comfortable, parking was only $15 per night 1/2 block away. location was close to everything. it was a great stay. will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: Having never driven in to New Orleans before, it was somewhat unsettling. However, the minute we pulled up to the hotel on O'Keefe Street, we felt right at home. The staff were very, very helpful making us feel somewhat special. The young gentleman at the door who unloaded our vehicle (how special is that?) was very friendly and helpful also. The room was huge. In fact, the kitchenette area, bedroom, washroom and living room were all distinctively separate. We were in a corner suite, so we ultimately had three different window views. We would definitely revisit this facility, and would certainly recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: waters44
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights, the location is great just two blocks from Bourbon Street. All the staff are so pleasant and attentive, nothing is too much trouble - they will even cook your waffles for you! They even let us leave our baggage, post our cruise whilst we waited for our flight home

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: LilyTheCatLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for the budget conscious traveler! We got a upgraded to a suite at our arrival (great!) and everyone is just so nice. Nice rooms, not to much luxuries but for the price, you would be a fool to ask more. Really really close to Bourbon Street and everything to see in New Orleans. Good breakfast, really clean and secure....really, I have nothing else to say but: next time, we will come back here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean room - great location”
Reviews.Author: PoppyCottonwood
Reviews.Content: We had four nights hear and really loved the place. Highlights include the buffet breakfast (hot and cold food, including a fantastic waffle maker) and the really helpful staff who helped us with some itinerary problems we were facing. The location was fantastic because it wasn't right in the French Quarter, but was only a short 5 minute walk to Bourbon Street and all the craziness that exists there. It was great to get away from the noise when we wanted to sleep. The room was huge and had two TV's and a mini kitchenette and a lounge room. The place was more like an apartment that a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: justtravelng
Reviews.Content: I found the motel on Trip Advisor and it was great!! If you drive you park 1 block away cost $15.00/day. Reasonable for NO. The front desk staff was extremely freindly. Very helpful to assist in making your visit great. Room was clean. We got an upgrade because it wasn't real full. Your one block from Canal Street. By a all day pass $3.00 on the trolly. You get to Trolley all over the city. Royal street is a fun street to shop. Bourbon street is 4 blocks easy walk. If you like sea food. Acme Oyster house is 2 block. Riverfront shopping area has good resturants. Oceana Resturant just off Bourbon. Ask for upstrairs. Quieter and alot of locals eat there. We were so glad we found this resonable hotel, great service, and walking distance to all the great sites. Pick this one. Enjoy NO

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MARSHE2000
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a number of times and would highly recommend it. The location is great: close to Canal; between the French Quarter and CBD; a short walk from the E2 (airport bus) stop. The manager and staff go out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay. We usually come during Jazz Fest, which is one of the most expensive times to visit the city. Their rates are reasonable and include a decent buffet breakfast with eggs, grits, waffles and fresh fruit. Sure, there are many spectacularly beautiful and historic hotels in New Orleans. However, we don't spend much time in the hotel, so we prefer value accommodations that enable us to spend more on dining and live music.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend! Great room and George was excellent!"”
Reviews.Author: KyrieAndKarlsohn
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans as a couple and and my new husband and I stayed there for the first two nights of our honeymoon. When we arrived George greated us and was very helpful. The area was very busy that week and were getting ready for the basketball finals. When we booked our room there was a non-smoking Queen available although we preferred a smoking king, we were fine with that because we realized they were busy. We did ask George if there happened to have been a smoking king cancellation so we could upgrade if there was one was available. He told us there wasn't a smoking king available but there was a non-smoking king which he voluntarily upgraded us to at no additional charge. Not being from the area when we arrived we parked in the wrong garage and he told us that instead of paying for that garage while we were there the two days that if we parked in the one that the hotel used not only was it valet parking but we could come and go as we pleased and not have to pay additional fees when we re-entered. There was a charge through the hotel to use this garage (from what I had read on internet most hotels in area do have an additional parking fee so we weren't suprised by this) Using the garage that he recommended actually ended up cheaper on us so this was a plus. After checking in I was looking at the travel brochures for the area. We asked if he could suggest anything to do while we were there he offered some suggestions on tours and such and also asked him if he could recommend a restaurant in the area and he suggested a couple to us Deanie's Seafood was the one we went with and it was a very good recommendation. Over dinner we decided to do the Haunted Histories walking tour which he was able to book for us for the next evening when we got back to the hotel. We got to our room and it was very nice! Another employee brought our luggage up on a cart and even unloaded it for us when we got to the room. A very large comfortable king size bed with plenty of nice fluffy pillows. There was a small desk next to the TV, a microwave and a fridge in room in a small kitchen area with a sink, there was also an in room safe at no additional charge. The bathroom was very spacious, clean and well stocked. Air Conditioning in room was excellent as well. There was a snack vending area on our floor which was an even number floor and the ice machine was one floor below us, they were on the odds. Breakfast was great! Awesome selection with two different waffle makers, eggs, sausage or bacon, gravy and biscuits, cereal, yogurt, and fruit, Attendants kept everything well stocked.We very much enjoyed our stay here and like several other reviews it's pretty un-assuming from the outside but a very nice inside. We will definitely be staying with them on our next trip out there and we highly recommend this place to anyone! If you do visit tell George we said,"Hello!"if you see him. :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: tracey s
Reviews.Content: Great place. Like many other people, we were upgraded (he said because we were staying several days) and we were checked in early. The room had 2 queen beds, a couch and an easy chair and was very spacious. It also had a microwave, fridge and cabinets and was very clean. We were close to the elevator and there was no issue with a loud bell. Housekeeping was very good and kept the room clean and well supplied. The breakfast was great--except the eggs!!!! They were overcooked and had an odd texture--maybe they were dried? We couldn't eat them, but they had hard boiled ones as well that were perfectly done and peeled. They also had either bacon or link sausage, cheese cubes, grits (good--need salt), pastry, muffins, waffles, cereal, juice, coffee, water. It runs until 9:30, or 10:00 on weekends and is kept well stocked. All in all a great hotel at a super price (comparatively speaking).

Reviews.Title: “Overall reccomend”
Reviews.Author: chicocat20
Reviews.Content: For the money, I don't think it could be beat. Very nicely appointed rooms w/ flat screen tv's, fridges, and microwaves. Breakfast was good as well. A short walk across Canal St. to the French Quarter. My only complaint would be the water pressure in our shower (room 706) was very weak. It must vary by room cause our friends next door said their water pressure was like a fire hose! haha. If you're on a budget, this hotel is well worth it! Far better than any 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: LadyKLondon
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late in the evening after 14 hours of flying and the guy on the desk was so friendly and helpful. All of the staff were welcoming and friendly throughout my stay. The hotel was great value for money and I found the facilities clean and tidy. I had free wifi in my room, breakfast was included (including waffles made to order!). It was a short walk to Canal St and Bourbon St and even the walk to the Convention Centre was managable (even more so if you take the streetcar down Canal St to shorten the journey). I can't receommend the place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,reasonable price close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKeepcool
Reviews.Content: Definitely agree with other positive reviews. Close enough to walk to the French Quarter but far enough away when you need a break from the zaniness of the Quarter. One block west of Canal Street which provides convenient walking access to streetcars and the Quarter. Hotel room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was adequate. Hotel staff were friendly and professional. We arrived around 10 am, well before check-in, so they stored our luggage and made sure we had a room by 2:00. They also let us check out late, around 2:15, and called a cab to pick us up at 5:15 for the trip to the airport. I neglected to get the name of the desk manager that helped us on check out day, but he was the best. Will definitely stay here again next time we visit NO.

Reviews.Title: “Road trip with friends”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: Not a bad location, reasonable priced, rooms are nice, comfortable, and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Better than it appears!”
Reviews.Author: Mulvas6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March, 2012. Before arriving, I wasn't thrilled with the looks and wasn't sure about it's location as it was our first trip to NOLA. However, the people, rooms and location was perfect! Close to the French Quarter, but located in the quiet business district. We didn't spend near what the French Quarter Hotels were and it was nice to be away from the partiers occasionally. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very close to bourbon street!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: Average hotel only 5 minutes from the party life on Bourbon street. We were updated to a bigger room and had plenty of space... You can tell that it's not a new Hotel but it was ok, and very close to French quaters... Breakfast ok but if you're hungry there's a subway next door...

Reviews.Title: “So Nice!”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is great if you are wondering,very close to the main drag but far enough so its not as loud at night. This was our first time to New Orleans. I picked this hotel based off of the reviews and was not disappointed. Every staff member was so nice and welcoming. They let me print my boarding pass in the managers personal office, also arranged taxi and recommendations in the area. Rooms were clean and nice as well, we stayed as a couple on an upper floor. Prices were good too for the service that you will get. Close to very expensive hotels as well. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: DonMike68
Reviews.Content: We visited NO to attend the final four and vacation. We would concur with most visitors who stayed here that the value along with location and very helpful and friendly staff really made our stay an enjoyable one. On our arrival we were also upgraded to a king room and to the far end of the hall (away from elevators) we stayed for eight nights and the room was maintained well each day. The small fridge and microwave was a nice touch. Comfortable bed. We were a 10 to 12 minute walk from the superdome and about the same to Bourbon street. We walked to and from both areas at all hours and felt comfortable at all times. Aprox. 5 mins from the Canal street street car stop and 10 mins from the St Charles street car stop. $33 dollar flat rate cab fare to hotel from airport, 20 min ride. Subway shop next door was handy. Breckfast was nothing fancy but better than adequate. Over the course of our 8 night stay we really don't have anything negative to say about hotel. We would highly recommend for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is like being with family.”
Reviews.Author: DLBBell
Reviews.Content: The location proved to be perfect for attending the Final Four, as the hotel is close for walking to any of the city's main neighborhoods but also close to the streetcars. The breakfast was extensive, the rooms and hotel overall were clean and well kept, and everything else one would want in a good hotel stay was experienced. But it was the staff that really made our stay and the place excellent. Our rooms were upgraded for us upon our arrival with particular attention paid to the access needs of my 88 year-old father-in-law. And it just got better from there. It was, by far, the friendliest most helpful staff I've ever encountered at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cutecdnchick
Reviews.Content: Short walk will get you to all the action, and even walking distance to the stadium. We went for a football game and when they found out at checkin that we were cheers for the Saints, they upgraded our room - nice! One block away is a convenience store. Room has a fridge so you can stock up on some items for the trip. We only paid about 100/night, never needed a cab, breakfast was included and front desk was super friendly - can't go wrong! Would recommend to anyone. Fancy -no, but in New Orleans, who is hanging out at the hotel anyways??

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrookeChandler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Quality Inn and Suites because of the all the great reviews on trip advisor and the price. When we arrived at the hotel, we were immediately greeted and helped with our bags. Our room was upgraded without even asking, check in was a breeze and we were in a suite within 5 mins of arrival. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. The suite was large and very clean. The hotel offers free Wi-fi, a decent free breakfast (include typical fare plus a few extras). The hotel was perfect for us, it is a really nice budget hotel. The location was ok, we spent most of our time in the French Quarter and the Garden District. It took us 5 mins to walk to Bourbon Street and 7 mins to St Charles street car. It took us about 20 mins to walk to Jackson Square. I felt safe walking in the dark to the hotel. The staff even called the airport shuttle (without asking) because they were late. This hotel has a lot to offer at the right price!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Heatherh321
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel in less than six months. This is NOT a five star hotel but it exceeded our expectations in every way. Very clean, breakfast included, staff went above and beyond to be friendly and helpful and the price is right. The location is a three minute walk to the Quarter. I would stay here again and again. Close enough to be convenient, far enough away to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chalyn251
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not look like anything special and it does not have a courtyard or any New Orleans architecture but the service and location are great. The manager Stanley and his team do a fantastic job of making you feel welcome and like part of the family. They are very knowledgeable about New Orleans and all that goes on there. This is a multi-year award winning hotel. Located just two blocks from the French Quarter it is very convenient to all major attractions and street car lines. But it is just far enough away from the craziness of Bourbon and Canal streets. I have stayed here 3 times and I would highly recommend. A complimentary breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break '12”
Reviews.Author: Texas4kiddos
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews and ranking on this site. It wasn't as close to the French Quarter as I had hoped. The room had an odor in which there was an air purifier going when we entered the room. Soon after, someone came in and removed it. The sink was stopped up and the water drained VERY slowly. The staff was great and very helpful and the breakfast was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Fishbiscuit
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our girlfriend weekend getaway. Checkin was a breeze and very helpful-- even recommending a good place to catch a bite after a long flight. We got a room with 2 queen beds and were surprised to find that it was actually two bedrooms separated by the bathroom and a kitchenette. Perfect for a little privacy, and the free wifi and the minifridge to store water were the only frills we needed! We did not partake in the continental breakfast as we wanted to save ourselves for beignets and brunch @ commander's palace, but it smelled good each morning as we left! I read quite a few reviews of this hotel before our trip, so to discount the two things that came up most in my reading: 1. "Hotel needs updating." We had flatscreen tvs in both bedrooms, and while things weren't new-new, everything was spic and span clean, smelled pleasant (and not like an air freshener cover-up job !) and the beds were very comfortable. This is a no frills place to stay but who comes to New Orleans to hang out in a hotel room? 2. "Location is in a bad part of town." I would say that just in every city you have to be street smart and New Orleans is no different. In our experience whether we were leaving the hotel at 9am or 9pm, the streets are well travelled and there were always other people around. It is a short 2 block walk to Canal Street, and then 2 blocks south to Bourbon and the St. Charles Streetcar. After one night on Bourbon Street we were so thankful to be able to walk away from it back to the quietness of our hotel. I can't imagine staying any closer to that insanity. If I find myself in New Orleans again I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: belkaye
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room with 2 queens as that was the only room available when we booked & when we arrived they asked if we would mind being changed to a King room - this was an upgrade so we were pretty happy. The room was very comfortable and quiet, we were on the end so we had a view from both sides. It is walking distance to the french quarter & we felt very safe walking around late at night. The people on the front desk were very friendly and greeted us happily everytime we walked passed. We would definitely return to this hotel. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Redwhine21224
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights for an extended birthday weekend. Service was excellent- we arrived early, and the front desk was able to accommodate getting us into a room (and bumped us up to a king-thanks!!!). The hotel was a short walk to the french quarter, but the location was quiet- we were on the 7th floor, and only heard any sort of street noise once- you're not near bars, etc. The breakfast was good-we liked the waffles, and there was a decent selection. Housekeeping missed us one day, which was a surprise since we were gone from our room for over 5 hours- 10am-3pm, but the front desk sent towels up. Some of the floors (elevator and lobby bathroom) could have been cleaner, but room was clean, and hotel was nice overall. Not the most romantic place to stay, but the price and location were good. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Adventure T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the NOLA half and full marathon. We had 10 people in total staying at this hotel and each one of us had a slightly different room layout. Ours was perfect. Two queen beds for 4 people, a kitchenette and a bath that was a little small, but did the job. As everyone said in these reviews, the location is perfect. Walking distance to the start of the race, the french quarter, trolly, etc. I gave this place 5 stars because the value was incredible due to the low cost, great location, friendliness of the staff (very accommodating) and a hot breakfast each AM. They even put the breakfast out early for the marathoners. Caution: if you are expecting a sparkling room with nice fixtures, this isn't the place. Our shower drained slowly and the tile floors weren't the cleanest, but I expected such. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER!”
Reviews.Author: wilson4intx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Orleans Marathon. Hubby and son ran. Room was great. 2queen was actually 2 separate bedrooms! No complaints at all. And the staff went way above and beyond, always asked us if we needed anything, AND they even set up a special 5 am continental breakfast for the runners and friends when normal breakfast start wasn't until 7am on Sunday. Even reduced the parking daily fee to $15 vs. normal $17. Yep, would definitely stay here again. Was half a mile to the race start, 3 blocks to French Quarters (Canal & Bourbon.) Very safe area, just can't say enough about this hotel and their staff. THANKS, everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: savvy17
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before and were looking for a room for just one weekend night. When I called the hotel directly, the manager was very helpful and able to find us a room. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was good for us. Parking is discounted for guests at the hotel at the garage down the street. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dcmusicstudio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and I would definitely stay here again. Clean,quiet, convenient, and comfortable. We did not rent a car, but notice the parking garage was Right next door. We were able to easily get from the airport using the Jefferson Transit E2 bus that dropped us off 2 easy walking blocks away and we used that to return to the airport.$4 round trip,can't beat that! We used a taxi once the first night and walked every where or on a few occasions we used the street cars which are only one-two blocks away. We felt safe at all times. Our room was on the street side,but only once did street noise wake me up. Continental breakfast was just fine every morning. If you are looking for a simple,good value, allowing you to spend your $$ on other things than this is for you. The bed was comfortable, the shower worked just fine, towels fine also. If you are expecting the Roosevelt than go down one block. After walking Bourbon St. We couldn't imagine staying on the middle of all that noise! We truely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: lcastanon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during mardi gras. The location is great for its price. You are a block away from the parade routes and the much more expensive Roosevelt is down the block as well. Front desk was friendly and helpful. They upgraded me to a bigger room at no charge and without asking. Breakfast is included in the rate, standard fare but does the job. The shower in my room was a bit slow to drain, I guess that was my only real gripe. The walls feel a little thin, so i'd recommend a room away from the elevator, it makes a loud beep every time its passing a floor. If you are a light sleeper, youre likely to be startled by it if you are sleeping near there. Furniture and stuff is a little dated, one of the drawers in my dresser was beat up, could use a renovation soonish. Overall, the location, the friendliness of the staff and the value make it for a good stay in a very expensive time of the year to stay in the french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Room, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Punkyb44
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of Trip Advisor reviews and it was #1 for us also. It was within walking distance of the French Quarter and all of the points of interest we had time to do in 2 days. They also recommended the best tours, which we did with a van ride of the city and a walking ghost tour. All were rated 5 stars for us. Breakfast was also both hot and cold foods which was more than enough to get us started for a busy day. They even let us stay beyond the checkout time to walk the streets as we didn't need to catch our cruise boat until after 12pm. The room was actually 2 rooms which turned out well for us as one was a snorer. All we had ordered was 2 queen beds. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: askabrit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights prior to going on a cruise. Staff were outstanding, very helpful and they even sent a Fax for us with no charge. Location is great, within a couple of blocks of two streetcar lines and a short walk to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. Accommodation was clean, comfortable and well maintained. The room we had was a fairly good size with two double beds and a sofa. Shower was hot but not very strong spray. Breakfast was very good with the usual cereal, muffins, scrambled egg, toast etc. We took a taxi from the airport to get there, $33 about 20 minute ride. If you don't have much luggage consider using the local bus from the airport the stop is only one block away. Subway is in the same building, handy for a quick bite on the run. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBadgerVR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights leading up to and over Mardi Gras. Block and a half out of the French Quarter which is great when you're heading back to bed as the Quarter is just horrendously loud. The room included a decent breakfast which they were very liberal with the time it was supposed to be finished. Eggs scrambled or hard boiled, bacon/sausage alternated, cereals pastries, etc.. The Desk Crew (George in the evening) were fantastic, friendly and helpful. All in all a very good experience. Only improvements would be exhaust fans in the bathrooms and the elevator has a loud buzzer go off at every floor which could be toned way down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for Mardi Gras. This hotel is a great location as far as being within walking distance of Bourbon Street. We were 2 blocks away from Canal Street and about 4 blocks from Bourbon. The only thing I did not like is that it was still a little noisy at night when we tried to sleep, but that was only becuase it was Mardi Gras I'm sure, and you can't really avoid it. My only real complaint as far as the hotel itself is that some of the housekeeping crew, I'm not sure, it was 2 guys... it was about 12:30 in the morning and they were being really noisy in the hallway slamming stuff around and talking really loudly which is dis-respectful in my opinion. Other than that, the staff here is EXCEPTIONALLY helpful and friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and experience”
Reviews.Author: Devorah L
Reviews.Content: The staff is great; they defintiely go out of their way. It's relatively cheap, just two blocks from the quarter, and near two streetcar lines. And there's a (cold) continental breakfast included and coffee/tea all day. I can't emphasize enough how the warm and attentive staff made our trip great!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location, and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: wynberg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. As per other reviews the hotel is great value in comparison to costs of other hotels in area. Only a short walk to French Quarter and streetcar to Garden District. Parking is provided in nearby garage at cost of $17 which hotel will charge to your room. This compares to regular 24 hour parking rate of $29. Room was comfortble and clean. New Orleans is an expensive place in and around the French Quarter for accommodation, meals and parking but if this is the area you want to see then there is no point in staying in the suburbs. The QI is excellent value and a great spot to spend a few days without blowing the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: LauraMtPleasant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quality Inn two nights in early February prior to taking a cruise. As the main purpose was to meet family and get on the ship with time to spare, we wanted to spend as little as possible and, at the price, had no expectations for this place beyond a reasonable level of cleanliness. We were astouded at how great the staff was--they answered every question and met every need with little or no prodding and made the two days in NOLA delightful. This was a great value and I've already recommended it to friends. Whatever they are paying the staff, they deserve more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: JACKIE T
Reviews.Content: Really a wonderful place in New Orleans. It is near everything. I could walk to the French Quarter and the Superdome and the streetcars. The staff was terrific, especially Stanley, I know there may be nicer and more expensive places, but I don't think you will find a more convenient and nicer hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Mid-MN-Tourist
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here Feb 1. Thru Feb 5. 2012. Arrived after 10pm and were upgraded to king beds, staff was very informative and friendly. Room were dated, but clean and quiet. Would stay here gain while visiting NOLA. Location is only a few blocks from French quarter. Felt safe walking in the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: OhioMeisje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a pre-cruise hotel. The room was large with two queen beds. The beds were in separate rooms, each room with its own flat screen TV and a bathroom between. The breakfast was good and more than continental. The staff was VERY accommodating and friendly. The hotel is located about 1 block from Bourbon Street and Canal Street in the downtown area next to the French Quarter. The location is too far to walk with your luggage to the cruise port so I recommend a taxi which is $7 per person. The hotel staff was nice enough to call us a taxi. Without luggage, the walk is doable down to the Riverwalk, casino and restaurants at the port, or you can catch the streetcar on Canal Street. The only places to eat dinner around this hotel are in the French Quarter. We didn't venture out very late so I don't know how safe the area is at night. There is a Subway sandwich shop attached to the hotel but it closes early. If we had to do it over again, we would choose to stay closer to St. Louis Cathedral, Cafe Du Monde, Riverwalk and the casino. There are several hotels down there but I am sure the price is much more.

Reviews.Title: “Depending on your needs this may or may not be the place for you”
Reviews.Author: doovid
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel provides great value and is in reasonable proximity to the French Quarter. The rooms contain a refrigerator and microwave which may add convenience to foodstuffs purchased at a nearby supermarket. Breakfast too is a nice feature. The staff are friendly as many reviewers have stated. My room maintained a musty odor, the windows were dirty and the view depressing. If you want a view that reminds you where you are then another room or hotel may be preferred. In addition I concur with other reviewers that the foot traffic in the area is sparce leading one to feelings of insecurity though this may just be a perception. I was travelling alone while attending a conference several blocks away so this probably was not the ideal place for me. Had I been on vacation with a partner perhaps it would have been more tolerable. I moved out after one night given lack of alternative room availability and the management was supportive of my decision.

Reviews.Title: “30th Birthday in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: So I booked a double room for my 30th birthday where 20+ friends and family were flying in to celebrate. About half stayed at the Quality Inn and half stayed elsewhere. Going into the trip, I was worried because people who have lived or traveled in New Orleans mentioned that the O'Keefe St area wasn't the safest at night. Upon arrival, my fears were put to rest, seeing as the swanky Roosevelt hotel was right next door and Canal St is only two blocks away. I never felt endangered out at night either by myself or with a group. The staff was super-friendly and accomodating, and the rooms were clean and plenty large. From a location standpoint, the hotel was an easy walk to pretty much anywhere in the French Quarter as well as close to the St. Charles trolley line to get to the Garden District or Uptown. While not the newest or plushest hotel in the area, the great service and inexpensive room price more than made this a solid choice. I would definitely recommend, especially for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service I've ever experienced!!”
Reviews.Author: jenniferyocham80
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 adults and 6 kids stayed a night here in December. We got in later in the evening after an almost 9 hour drive from Oklahoma. They front desk guys were so wonderful!! After getting us checked into our rooms, they provided us with a stack of take out menus and gave us great suggestions for take out. Let us hang out in the lobby all evening eating, and letting the kids play. They kept asking if they could get us anything. Very very great people!! The rooms were a little small, and nothing fancy. But, we were not there to sit in our rooms so that didn't really matter to us. The location is perfect!! Super close walking distance to everything. We will stay here every time we come back! Price is great & service is priceless!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it. Book!!!”
Reviews.Author: cawte21
Reviews.Content: Pretty much everything about this place was great. The stand out thing about this hotel are the staff - I could gush about them for hours! From the moment we arrived, weary from travelling and way too early to check in (or so we thought) not only were we checked in immediately, but also upgraded to a king room - we were not expecting this at all! From then on the service just excelled, we didn't walk past a member of staff without a greeting, a smile, "do you need anything" etc. All tours they will book at the desk for you, full breakfast (it's good!) and close enough to walk safely to Bourbon st without having to be close enough to here it at night (I've read in previous reviews about the area being a bit sketchy and "ghetto" - not the case!) Excellent, book it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for staying in NOLA with older kids”
Reviews.Author: MadameHousewife
Reviews.Content: The hotel is always clean, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Located across Canal from the French Quarter it's about a 5 minute walk. We've been staying here 2-3 times a year for the last 10 years. It's reasonably priced and far enough from the Quarter to get a quiet night's sleep. Breakfast is the normal fare: fruit, yogurt, eggs, bacon, bagels, toast and waffles. The waffle with the fleur de lis on it is a highlight. Parking is nearby and runs about $15 a day. If you arrive on the train you can do without a car altogether. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk or you can easily hail a cab. There isn't an official "business center" but anytime I've asked they've allowed my to use the office computer. The suites are perfect for traveling with older kids who can feel as if they have a bit of privacy after mom and dad shut the door. Two televisions keep everyone happy once you are in for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “#1- GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: dkj965
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011, could not have had a better experience!! Comfortable room,bed and our bathroom was clean and everything was working. Fridge & microwave clean and working. Location is GREAT, no problem with safety walking from FQ. We are already planning a return trip to NOLA, and are booking here again. Staff is super.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: timnanna1974
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 5 star accommodations, stay somewhere else. If you are looking for 5 star service at a good value, stay here. We stayed for 3 nights during our first visit to New Orleans and were very happy with our choice. Every staff member went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They were helpful in providing a room upgrade as well as giving us advice on what to do with our time. The suite we were upgraded to had 2 rooms plus a bathroom. It wasn't fancy or large by any means, but it was clean and did for us what we needed. We had no problem with safety walking to and from the hotel at all times. The only suggestion I would have is to vary the breakfast offerings daily as they were the same everyday we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: curatokid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel in December, on arrival everyone was very helpful, but as many have said the rooms are so old and outdated in need of an urgent refurbishment, the bathroom fittings are all old and worn, our friends stayed at the Hotel Monteleone in the French Quarter for less than we were paying !! How this hotel got so high in the ratings I do not know, breakfast was OK but what is annoying is there are not enough seating areas and this then spills over into a lounge area, when the tables are vacated they are not cleaned or wiped down by the staff who stand there watching. The area is not very nice, my wife would not walk round on her own during the day and I must say we were very uneasy at night looking over our shoulder all the time, lots of drunks around, New Orleans was not what I expected , Burbon Street now has sex shops etc and shops selling cheap alcohol which attract lots drunks. I would not stay at this hotel if I return to New Orleans...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: bulldog3777
Reviews.Content: Close to the French Quarter. That was our main goal. Price, about $125 a night. That was our 2nd goal. This hotel met both. The rooms were clean, the service was outstanding. I have never met service people that were so friendly. The breakfast was really good for a free meal. Eggs, grits, sausage, cereal, muffins and more. Better believe I will stay here the time I am in New Orleans. Stayed two nights in prep for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LOOK ANY FURTHER!!!”
Reviews.Author: weluvcubaCambridge
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 kids ages 13 & 15) stayed at this hotel from Dec 31st for a three night stay. We booked the hotel solely on the Tripadvisor rating. Let me tell you, the ratings were spot on! The customer service we received from ALL staff, especially Stanley, Glen, and George made us feel like we were at a five diamond motel! Although this is an older building it is maintained impeccably and the rooms were kept spotless. The breakfast bar had many choices, and aside from the EXCELLENT staff, the location is absolutely amazing in proximity to the French Quarter. We had a very short walk to Canal street, which is the boundary for the quarter. We also caught a Saints game on January 1st and had a short walk to the Superdome. The hotel is also very close to the Charles Street trolley line, which we used during our stay. This was our second visit to the Big Easy however was our first visit to the Quality Inn. When we go back we will definitely book here again! A big thankyou to ALL the staff who went out of their way to make our stay most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Price, Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: snowlin
Reviews.Content: My great 4-night experience with the New Orleans Downtown Quality Inn started the moment I got out of the taxi in front of the hotel. Everything positive you read in the TA reviews about this hotel is spot on! The next time I visit to New Orleans, I'm definitely going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service doesn't make up for lack of safety”
Reviews.Author: marygeralyn
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I was excited that I had gotten a great hotel for a cheap price, but I was sorely disappointed. Great customer service goes a long way, but it does not make up for the hotel's issues. The Good: The service really is as good as everyone says. Art (a popular man at the front desk) is fantastic at his job. He really does go the extra mile. He anticipated any issues we might have and acted accordingly. He was very helpful in setting up tours and airport transportation, and provided valuable information about the area. Also, breakfast is included and is pretty good, even for the picky eaters in my party. Our room had two bedrooms, connected by a bathroom. It seems like it was a one-bedroom suite where they just made the living room into a bedroom. We were very happy with the room. The Bad: The hotel is quite old and needs renovating. The photos are more flattering than they should be. The location, while a 4 block walk to Bourbon, is located in a pretty sketchy area. In order to get to the bars and restaurants, you have to walk through a really ghetto section. Even though there were three of us travelling together, we had to take cabs home because it simply wasn't safe enough to walk home. Across the street is a vacated office building, and there are several parking lots nearby. This would be fine if we had no intentions of going out to dinner or for drinks at night, but no one wants to be that stressed on vacation. Overall: The hotel is a good value for a family or a group who has no intentions of leaving the hotel in the evening. Otherwise, bring ear plugs and just stay in the quarter. As a young woman who loves travelling, safety is always my biggest concern. Great customer service is not worth a lack of safety.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff make this THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nitros_mum
Reviews.Content: I've been a bit lax in finishing my reviews from our recent trip to the US, but when I think back to this hotel, it's all good. We arrived early, and while our room wasn't ready, we checked our bags and parked the car with directions to Royal st (courtesy of Mr Glen running up to the lights with a map so we didn't have to walk back to the hotel). There was an away Saints game on and Royal street was shut off with a big screen and vendors cooking on the street. The sights and smells were fantastic. Welcome to New Orleans! When we headed back to the hotel to check in, Mr Stanley advised us that we'd been upgraded to a suite as it was the first room available. Nice! The room itself was spacious, and the a/c worked a treat. Oh, and our bags had already been delivered. We ate breakfast here both mornings of our stay, which was simple but tasty (love those waffles!), and added even more value for money to what already was a reasonable price place to stay. It really is the staff that make this place. How many hotels remember you by name whenever you walk in and out? I would have no hesitation recommending this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The management is very charming here,but the rooms though big are a bit run down.”
Reviews.Author: gabrieltheangel72
Reviews.Content: First the location is adequate,being a 10 minute or less walk to Bourbon Street. The rooms or rather Appartements are very spacious and the Management go out of their way to help you in any way they can. That does compensate somewhat,though not entirely to the actual quality of the rooms. Which have a bit of grotty feel,as does the hotel in general. May need a bit of renovation. Of course internet,ac and all else in the room worked very well as they do in America generally Overall a reasonable hotel with a reasonable price. But as Nos 2 on trip Advizor,it is bit surprising

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: crandall3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting New Orleans. When we pulled up to the hotel, the young man out front was very helpful with our luggage and guided my husband on where to park. We found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. My son really enjoyed the bag of spicy chips left on the made beds. There was a microwave, refrigerator, and two tvs in our double room, which was really nice for my husband and son. The front desk worked with us on getting a room close for my sister-in-law. They also gave her a suite a no additional charge! We also asked them for an opinion on a bus tour and they not only steered us in the right direction (forgive the pun), but they also booked it for us! The hotel provides a hot breakfast, the location was convenient (we were able to walk to The French Quarter), and they had laundry facilities so we were able to catch up on clothes after being on the road for several days. What I really appreciated was when the hotel staff sent my son's writing journal back to our house (priority mail and at no cost to us) when he forgot it in the nightstand of our room. Overall, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location was convenient and the hotel and room were comfortable and clean. We would definitely stay here again. A good value and friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: farmgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel earlier this month and found the location to be easy walking distance to the French Quarter and to the Superdome. A new Rouses supermarket was only a few blocks away (and the blocks are short) to pick up a few groceries when we got tired of eating out. A microwave , fridge and small bar sink were great to have in the room. The bedding and furniture are pretty tired - some burn holes in the "non smoking" room but it was clean. We found it hard to regulate the room temperature - too hot at night and when you put on the A/C it blows straight on your head. The windows do not open. The staff were extra friendly and helpful . We chose this place solely because of TA. I would recommend for a good budget choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mactravels78
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in December before a cruise. The hotel is clean and fresh and I was upgraded to a large 2 bedroom suite. The room was comfortable and everything worked. The staff was universally attentive and helpful. The hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast. It is only 4 blocks from Bourbon Street and an excellent value for money. For an inexpensive, comfortable stay in New Orleans this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: SouthernHospitality2
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are modest (what you would expect in this price range), the location is pretty good and the staff is superb. First, I had asked for a room on a higher floor away from the elevators, and in order to accommodate this request, they upgraded me to a suite at the end of the hall - free of charge! As I said, the rooms are plain and the facility is a bit dated, but all areas of the hotel were very clean, including my room and bathroom. Bed was sufficient, and the room was quiet. The breakfast was free and better than I expected, with hot foods and a pretty large selection. Wi-fi was also free in my room. What really sets this hotel apart, however, is the staff. I had several interactions with them, and everyone from the on-duty manager right down to the cleaning staff and doormen were extremely welcoming, polite, friendly and willing to help out with anything I needed. I really can't say enough about the service - even with the average rooms, I would return to this hotel just because of the people. Location isn't bad - situated between the French Quarter (just a few minutes walk to Bourbon Street, but far enough so that it's quieter and away from the ruckus) and the business district. Overall, if you are looking for a budget-style hotel but don't want to sacrifice cleanliness or service, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, COMFY & CLOSE”
Reviews.Author: flystayplay
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is an exciting, vibrant and uniquely unequaled city. Having visited this city for years, I randomnly chose this property to pen a review. My decision to stay here was influenced by the $79.(AARP) price and the points offered by their loyalty program. The staff was very friendly and courteous. my one night stay there was better than expected. (I stayed in three diffrent hotels in three nights for the points.) Breakfast, gym and parking are offered but I did not avail myself to them. There is a SUBWAY restaurant on the corner. Please be mindful, as with MOST hotels in the USA, the person walking past you in the hallway is not necessarily a guest, safety first. No reflection on this property, Actually there is a comforting staff/security that greets you and often times gets to know you. Bourbon & Canal intersection is an easy three-block walk. The streets are NOT always smooth and there are holes all over, walk carefully. Three for One beers, Great Restaurants, Music and Dancing are copious. Streets are well lit and there are many NOPD Officers visible all the way to this Quality inn in a safe part of town. Getting from the New Orleans Louis Armstrong International Airport (MSY) is safe, simple and cheap when going by bus. From the upstairs platform take the E-2 (Jefferson Transit is the only city bus that serves the airport), for $1.50 all the way downtown to Tulane & Loyola on WEEKDAYS (till 9:20 PM last bus).then walk the four blocks to the hotel. On WEEKENDS taking the E-2 from the airport will only go two-thirds the way to downtown. It will let you off at Carrollton Ave where you will cross the street to the side of the Burger King and wait ten minutes for the #39 (Orleans Parish bus, another $1.50) that takes you all the way to Canal St.(last Stop) three blocks to the hotel. If arriving after the 9:20 pm bus, cabs cost $35. Plan your trip wisely,and arrive during the daytime; after dark, TAKE A CAB. Remember, travel lightly because you probably won't use all that stuff anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: scott g
Reviews.Content: I been to New Orleans several time on busness. This was a great stay for the price. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Buzzard05
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a four night stay at the Quality Inn and Suites New Orleans. Upon arrival I was greeted by two very friendly staff members who not only got me into my room four hours before check-in, but upgraded my room from a Queen to a King at no charge. The room, while small (think NYC hotels), was clean and very well laid out. The room was equipped with a microwave, a refrigerator, TV, and a safe. The refrigerator came in very handy for storing left-overs from the huge portions served in New Orleans. The bed was very comfortableâ€¦the pillows were awesome. The free wi-fi was very easy to use. The daily breakfast bar had a good selection and was always well stocked. The location of the Quality Inn and Suites is also very convenient. You arenâ€™t right in the midst of the party that is Bourbon Stâ€¦.but it is a very short walk (five minutes.) The Riverwalk/Casino area is about 3/4 of a mile away, but it is an easy (flat) walk. If you are going to a game at the Superdomeâ€¦it seems to be about Â¾ of a mile away as wellâ€¦again, an easy walk. Very close to the hotel are multiple little shops as well as a CVS and a Walgreens to stock your refrigerator during your stay. What makes this hotel truly special is the staff. Every single person I came into contact with went out of their way to assist me, recommended restaurants and attractions, and made it a point to wish us well on our daily journeys out and aboutâ€¦and greet us with a hello every time we came through the front door. If I am ever fortunate enough to head back to New Orleans, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UKC0uple
Reviews.Content: We got back a week ago from Nola this being our second time this year and our second visit overall. We stayed 11 nights at the Quality Inn on O Keefe Ave which is a nice place to stay, we were going for a budget holiday this time as our first visit to Nola was this June so a little tight on money. We arrived at our hotel 11 pm after a 22 hour journey from the UK. We were greeted by the Hotel clerk very courteously who immediately told us he would up grade us from Queen Beds to a suite Free of charge. I was going to give him a good tip later when we had sorted our belongings out. So of to our suite we went to find our bearings when the phone rang, having an idea it would be the clerk on the other end, I answered him as he ask if I was satisfied with the suite which I replied yes and that I had intended calling down to see him later. After sorting a few things in our room and freshening up we headed a couple of blocks away for a quick bite and a few drinks to take to our room, not before visiting the clerk at the reception desk. My tip to him brought a wide smile to his face â€˜Greatâ€™ he was happy and we were more than happy. Our Hotel the Quality Hotel include what they called a complementary Continental Breakfast which is really good, well itâ€™s a little more than continental as you get scrambled egg boiled egg and alternative meat days of bacon, sausage and 3inch burgers. Apart from choices of cereals fruit juice yogurts grits waffle makers toasters to make yourself, breads and rolls muffins jams fresh fruit, coffee and teas, which all were replenished swiftly. All in all a clean Hotel in all areas and the staff were helpful and obliging at all times I can recommend The Quality Inn to any one â€œwell done teamâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: galacticshimmer
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn is a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of the French Quarter. Mr. Art, who checked me, gave me a charming introduction to New Orleans and very kindly upgraded me to a suite! The staff were consistently service oriented and the complimentary breakfast was more than the usual bread and coffee. Although not a 4-star restaurant in style, it is pleasant, comfortable, safe and definitely worthwhile for the price. The Waldorf Astoria is around the corner and you're definitely getting a better deal than the Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for Several Reasons”
Reviews.Author: JeffG732
Reviews.Content: The Staff is excellent (George!!) and will provide local suggestions for the specific NO experience (food, shopping, music, etc) that you desire. Centrally located. 4 blocks from Bourbon, 4 blocks from Superdome, 3 blocks to the streetcar which will get you anywhere in the Quarter, and also get you to the Garden District, cemetaries, etc. Amazingly, while centrally located, there is very little street noise at night. When I travel to NO again, which I hope to be soon, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights last week. The hotel is located a block from Canal and four blocks or so from Bourbon; much more expensive hotels are within a couple blocks going towards the French Quarter, although not a lot of activity in the immediate area of the hotel. We were able to easily walk from the hotel all through the French Quarter; Jackson Square was perhaps a 20 minute walk; we even walked easily to Frenchmen Street although the staff suggested it was far enough that a cab might be warranted. It's also a couple of blocks to either the Canal Trolley or the St. Charles Trolley which gave us all the mobility you need for a short visit. When we arrived the staff couldn't do enough for us and upgraded us to a suite with a king bed instead of the queen room we had reserved. They act as a true concierge service and have great recommendations for things to do. The physical hotel is not much to look at and the breakfast is passable, although pedestrian, but as a place to drop after touring all day and going to the nightlife late into the night, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: ImreallyfromWNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited New Orleans for the first time and stayed at the Quality Inn & Suites for 4 nights. I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor ratings and price; other than that I was flying blind and had no idea about location, etc. My experience mirrored most of the reviews on this hotel. We arrived at about 10am and stowed our bags so we could get around. When we showed up later in the afternoon the manager offerred to upgrade us into a King Suite which was very comfortable and spacious. Breakfast is included - has eggs, fruit (not just garbage), free internet, microwave, refrigerator so you can save money for splurging on more fun things. Every staff person we interacted with from top to bottom was polite and customer oriented. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the French Quarter and a 10-minute walk to the St.Charles St. Trolley which for $3 takes you to the Warehouse district (museums), Garden District, and Uptown, so even without a car you can see a lot of the great neighbohoods without paying big bucks for transportation.
