This is a no frills place, some things are looking a bit dated, mostly clean, but with a friendly and accomodating staff, great location and a rate at least half of what most surrounding hotels are charging, if you are value-oriented and were planning on spending most of your time experiencing New Orleans rather than hanging out in your hotel room watching ESPN, staying here is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: We traveled in early November and stayed 3 nights at the Quality Inn on O'Keefe. It is within easy walking distance to Bourbon St., the Mississippi River, and Jackson Square. The trolley is within a couple blocks and an all-day pass is only $3/person. The price was under $300 for 3 nights which is incredible. The hotel was quiet which is important, located just a block from Canal St. but out of the crowds. The only drawback was that parking was $15/night, but it was in a secured parking garage just a half block down. Unloading/loading was easy, right in front of the hotel, although we stayed off season and during the week to avoid huge crowds. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, but there are many restaurants close-by on Canal and further, including a McDonalds, a Subway, and an IHOP. The greatest advantages were the location and the price. A very comfortable, clean, safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: mj316
Reviews.Content: I settled on 4 stars overall for the Quality Inn. If I could use half stars, I would have settled on 3.5 stars. There is a lot to like about this place. The location in particular is great. Easy walking distance to the french quarter/bourbon st area. It is also very good value for the location. In truth, the rooms are only average. Decent size, but a bit worn and dark. Very small bathroom and a bad shower. Overall I would say the are serviceable- not terrible, bu not great either. Breakfast is ok, but if you want a good brunch my advice is skip it. Valet parking is actually up the road... not really valet either as you are expected to drive it up yourself and pick it up. There is parking out the front to unload luggage. The valet is ok value, but just beware that it is not on site (or even all that close by) and is not technically valet. Overall, good value, good location, average rooms and half valet parking. I would recommend Quality Inn with a few reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first New Orleans Visit”
Reviews.Author: AfterDark
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay - nobody claims this to be a 5 star hotel - but the service lifts it above its relatively humble origins to provide an enjoyable, convenient, clean and comfortable stay. We really appreciated the friendly and helpful service and would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of ranking”
Reviews.Author: Augustan2011
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, I thought this would be great. It was a disappointment. The staff was exceptionally nice, courteous, and helpful. Kudos to them. The rooms were ok, not great. We had a room with 2 beds. Liked the 2 room concept and the fact that the beds were queens. I never stay at hotels with doubles. The bathroom was tiny! Felt cramped by the sink. Rooms were dark and carpet looked a bit worn. Although close to Canal street, it was a bit far from the riverfront. Fine for one night but not worthy of the number 1 ranking. Not my favorite hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: brooklyntraveler67
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Quality Inn and had a great time. I had booked thru Priceline for a room for 1. I was receiving a one bed room, but a friend I was meeting up with was coming in a day earlier than his hotel booking. I asked the front desk for a double bed if not I wanted a rolling bed provided at an extra charge. When I was checking in they provided me a double bed with no extra charge. I felt like I was the only person booked because I was staying in the weekdays. The only time I saw people were for breakfast. The set up was very nice and yes , they had eggs and bacon. A hot breakfast is a great perk. The staff was very polite and pleasant. My room also came with coffee maker , kitchen sink and a safe. The location is one block from Canal st. I also felt safe walking back to the hotel alone. The Roosevelt hotel is half a block away and there is a doorman outside and is well lit. In fact , I felt I was the smart traveler to have a great location at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: h2os4travel
Reviews.Content: The location was great. We were able to walk or catch a street car to where ever we wanted to go. Staff was great. When we checked in, they put in extra effort to find the best available room because we were staying past the weekend. The complimentary breakfast was adequate and was a good way to start the day. Our room was very quiet and clean. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BAKinKC
Reviews.Content: I had read so many positive reviews that my expectations may have been too high. I didn't feel the staff was any nicer than any other hotels I have stayed in. However, the nicest thing they did (and was very much appreciated) was upgrading our room at no extra cost. That along with the location made it a very good experience. We only had the buffet on our last day there as we were rushing to get to the airport. With so many great food options in New Orleans I regret even eating breakfast there once but if your looking to save money its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Betty_Boop080
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in this hotel ask for "Art" he will give you a great itinerary for you day.He was so kind. The room was one of the small rooms for 100.00 a night. It was SMALL our fridge did not work so we had a microwave. The Complimentary breakfast was nice, alot of food and many options to choice from.They have a parking deck for you to park in and they were also very nice. Overall the hotel was clean and we were out all day and night walking around so for the price we just needed a bed at night to fall into for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: cajuntravelers2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights- If you are use to fancy hotels with alot of extras-this is not the place for you-BUT, if you want a hotel with the neccessities and a great value-This is it! The staff, especially George, are all extremely helpful!!! They upgraded our room with no question and gave us walking maps and lead us to the best restaurants and places where to go and where not to go. The breakfast in the morning including waffles, eggs, grits, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt, and muffins--It was very clean, the rooms are a small. Bring your pillows because they are small and not very comfy! The only downfall was that we were awaken at 2:30am to the fire alarm-which i can vouch works very well- we walked down eight flights of stairs to find out that it was burnt popcorn! We would stay here again because of the friendly staff and the proximity it is to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, good location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugKT
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a girl's trip to NOLA for 5 days. This hotel wasn't overly fancy, but it was exactly what we needed. The location is good, just a short walk to the French Quarter (but beware some of the streets at night - still a little sketchy walking). The thing that really made our hotel experience great was the staff. Special thanks to George at the night desk - the restaurants he recommended served the best food we ate all trip. He was freindly and straight-forward, genuinely helpful. An unexpected bonus was the room layout: One bedroom, then the bathroom area, then another bedroom with a door that closed off the rest of the hotel room. We didn't get a suite, but we each essentially got our own room. Great for one person who is a night owl and one who isn't. The beds and pillows were comfortable, and everything was clean. Outside traffic for one room and neighboring door slams for the other disturbed sleep some, but were reasonable and to be expected. Overall, a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: BeccaLMadden
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its number one ranking and it is a credit to the manager and his hard working team. The location is very good, walking distance to all major sights in French quarter, the rooms were a good size and very clean, but what makes this place is the staff. Very personal service, we were upgraded to a queen suite which was a nice surprise. The staff were only too happy to talk about the city of new orleans, with tips on where to go, best resturants etc.. We booked a swamp tour through the hotel which was great. The best advice was to head to Frenchman st and avoid Bourbon to see the real NO nightlife. Highly reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Earned Their Ranking Once Again”
Reviews.Author: luvnormandy
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit. We enjoyed our stay so much last year that we booked again for 3 nights and brought friends with us this time. I booked months ago by phone, asking for 2 kings, but being a weekend, they only had 2 queens. I asked if they'd make a notation to upgrade us if kings became available. The night before arriving, I called to repeat my request and was told the same situation existed but they'd try. We arrived very early, around 9am, and of course no rooms were ready yet, so they took all our luggage and locked it up in a room behind the desk. The manager noted my request and asked for a cell number so he could call if something came available. We went out sight-seeing for the day and didn't return till around 3pm to find that we had been upgraded to a king suite and a room with 2 double beds - at no extra charge. The staff will tell you that the queen rooms are quite small, something we knew from the previous year, but they are such a great value for New Orleans and the location, that you don't mind. Both rooms were spacious with a love seat, making it very comfortable. Our suite had a separate bedroom/ refrigerator, sink & coffee area/ large bathroom. Although we don't spend much time in hotel rooms, it was nice to come back before changing for dinner and relax for a couple of hours. The staff is literally the friendliest & most accommodating people of any hotel we've stayed in the world. I don't know if the manager (same man we met last year) personally selects them for this reason or if they are trained, but it feels genuine. Each morning, they'd greet us and ask where we were headed, and in the afternoon when we returned, they'd ask how it was and what we'd eaten, etc. When we came down dressed for dinner the first night, the bellman went outside to hail a taxi for us, without hesitating - sometimes it's an easy feat and sometimes not. The second night when none of them were stopping, the desk clerk noticed what was going on & called a cab service so we wouldn't be late for our reservation. When we returned that evening, we asked if anyone could recommend a good place for breakfast. I expected the answer to be "here" since breakfast is complimentary and quite nice, although we didn't avail ourselves of it except for coffee. Instead, he immediately gave us 2 choices, and the one we chose was fabulous - not a place visitors would know but definitely one the locals are familiar with. Our flight didn't leave till 7pm the last day, so they again stored our luggage without a second thought. The system was down, so to expedite check-out, the desk clerks simply said they'd email the bill, not to worry about anything. When we returned for our luggage later that day, the manager gave us his card and told us to call on him anytime we were in town, and the bellman we'd become friendly with actually gave us a hug - like we were family. That might sound strange, and normally I wouldn't feel like hugging someone we barely knew, but it felt right. The staff makes you feel like you're staying as family members, not just anonymous guests. The service here is more attentive than many 5 star hotels we've stayed at. Only negative - and it's a small one - is the water pressure in the shower, but that may be typical of the city as someone told us. The drain in our sink seemed a bit slow the first day, but after the maid cleaned the room, I noticed it improved greatly. That tells me that when she cleaned the room, she noted it and had someone look at it - again the attention to detail. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. My son stayed at the Ritz last year the same weekend we were there and we had considered it, but after seeing his room and that the location on Canal around the corner from the Quality Inn is not really better, we knew we'd made the right choice. The difference in price did not warrant staying there. There is no better value in New Orleans - accommodations, location, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: oneash
Reviews.Content: First visit to N'awlins was made even better by this terrific hotel. Staff genuinely could not have been nicer or more helpful. Location is great (much more expensive hotels nearby) and rooms clean and spacious. Could not fault this place in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: MrSpike55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week the week of September / first part of Oct. We had a wedding in town to attend and decided to extend our stay and make a vacation out of it. As may others have stated, the staff here is exceptional. They made you feel welcome and greeted you warmly whenever you saw them. The check in process was quick and smooth, we were given room 414, an end room that had a separate living room area which was nice for a week long stay. The room had a coffee maker, microwave and small fridge. it also had a safe. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean and well kept though it did look a bit worn in places, but nothing to gripe about. My wife used the gym, which is small, but had some cardio equipment. The free breakfast was nothing fancy by had scrambled eggs, bagels, toast, make your own waffles, instant oatmeal, grits, bacon or sausage, yogurt, apple juice, orange juice, coffee & teas and some fruit. Danishes and muffins and perhaps a few other things... Nothing fancy, but for free it was great! Location wise it was perfect. Having never been to New Orleans I did not know about the various areas at all, but found this to be a great spot. You are literally a 5 minute into the French Quarter and about the same or less to the Canal Street & St. Charles Street Street car lines. Always felt safe walking to and from the FQ even late at night as there is another hotel on the route that has doormen / valets out front at all hours of the night. We had relatives staying at the Maison St. Charles (A Quality Inn as well) and we likes that place too, it looked more like a small apartment complex from the outside of the rooms, in a good way, and had a nice pool in the courtyard. If you have kids this might be a better place for that reason, but is a couple miles from the FQ, though the Street Car stops right out front. I will definitely stay at the Downtown QI & Suites when I come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Angil2000
Reviews.Content: Overall I was impressed, the other reviews did not lie! Is it a 5 star hotel-no. But it was clean, the staff was great, and it had everything I needed. I'd stay again if I'm back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: miky198830
Reviews.Content: for the price that you pay you get a great value exellent location rich breakfast nice staff clean

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable choice”
Reviews.Author: elpaulson
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the many positive reviews and was not disappointed. The location is great, quiet street but not far from the French Quarter and business district. As someone else has said, upon entering the lobby one afternoon, the man who checked me in greeted me by name! I was amazed! Another plus was the convenient and reasonably priced parking garage right next door.If you are in town for a few days,leave your car and walk or take the trolley around. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, but adequate, and can save a couple fifteen to twenty bucks that they would spend eating elsewhere. The room I had, with two queen beds, also had a sofa and chair for reading, a desk and chair, fridge and microwave. Overall a great choice for an expense-concious trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Lubans1
Reviews.Content: When was the last time the hotel staff called you by your name AFTER check in? Not lately? Come to the Quality Inn on O'Keefe in NOLA and enjoy the experience. The lobby is full of homey touches about Katrina and that might put you off, but the hospitality, courtesy, service and good value for money are what count. I have never seen such genuine attention to guests, not just me. Good quiet room, nice bkfs in a first floors space with windows, good location - easy three blocks from French Quarter and less than that to the St. Charles trolley. This hotel is emblematic of what New Orleans used to be many years ago. Remember the word lagniappe - a little bit extra for your custom. They practice it here with a passion. My chums and I were assembling in the lobby for a big walk up to Audubon park and the desk manager asked us if we would like some water! What a lovely gesture. We all opted in and were glad for it. All five of us, who stayed here in three separate rooms, say Way to Go! The Ritz with its famous customer service has nothing on the Quality Inn on O'keefe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great City.”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: New Orleans, what a great city!!!! This hotel rocks!!! This place has awesome breakfast. The hotel is very comfortable, the bed is real nice , great night sleep! It is close to the Quarter so you can walk and see what all is happening there! I look forward to my next stay here when I come for Jazzfest!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ckaspers
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review in my life but I'm compelled to let you know what a wonderful experience we had at the Quality Inn and Suites New Orleans. Based on others' write ups, I settled on this hotel because it appeared reasonable, within walking distance, yet, out of the noisy ear shot of the French Quarter (it is, in fact, within a few blocks of the Waldorf Astoria, Ritz Carlton etc.) , and even included a breakfast. All of that was true but it exceeded our expectations. Per suggestions through TripAdvisor comments, we had requested a room near the top with a king bed. When we came into the lobby, amidst a busy crowd of people in for a Saints' game, we asked if our request had been granted. We learned that we'd gotten a room with twin beds (not the way we wanted to start our weekend). But the Manager, Stanley Mascair, immediately asked if we could wait a brief time so he could make sure we had the room we wanted then proceeded to find us a room at the top with a king bed. During the short wait, I made a list of top rated restaurants that I'd read about and asked Mr. Mascair about them and the likelihood of securing a reservation so late. He said he'd be happy to try to make the reservations for us. And, in spite of this busy weekend and last minute requests, he was true to his word. We were always greeted cheerily by the staff whenever we returned to the hotel. While on our way to the airport, my husband realized he'd left a pair of pants hanging in the room closet. A quick call to Quality Inn and Mr. Mascair reassured him that they would send the pants to our home, if they found them. I thought to myself, "good bye pants" but they arrived within days of our return home. This is a clean, modestly decorated hotel in a great location, with great bedding and 5 Star service. --C. Kaspers

Reviews.Title: “Five star staff!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJCal
Reviews.Content: Was expecting good things from this hotel, especially after all the great reviews on Tripadvisor...and we were not disappointed. Arrived to the hotel at 8am after travelling overnight. Mike at the front desk apologised profusely for not having a room available for us but offered us free breakfast and to hold our bags. We availed of the breakfast, which was lovely and headed out to the French Quarter. The hotels location is great, less than five minutes to Canal Street and the French Quarter. When we arrived back to hotel our room was ready, comp upgrade to small suite. Had a small sitting area with separate TV , bedroom and small kitchenette with microwave and fridge. Like the other reviews, it really is the staff that made our stay. All are really friendly, helpful and always smiling! Breakfast is plentiful and better than other hotels. My husband was given a tray one morning to bring breakfast back to bed! The night staff are especially informative on where to go and what to do in the area. We checked out after 3 nights at around 5am, checkout was smooth and without asking for it we were given fruit and pastries to take with us, they even apologised for not having any hot items! The management should be very proud of their staff, some of the best we have come across.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quality Inn & Suites for 6 nights first week of Sept/11. Booked direct on-line at the hotels website and got a great rate. Upon arrival we asked to be upgraded and were given room 210, a large front facing room. Beds comfortable, pillows smallish and ok but a full size pillow would have really helped our sleep. The room was large with 2 queens and a sofa and chair. Small fridge great for keeping water cold. Our only complaint about the room is the single pane windows did not keep the noise out, which was from the flapping of the flags hanging near the window. And flap they did during our entire stay as it rained buckets and the wind was ferocious. Staffs at the hotel are very nice and service focused. The morning continental breakfast is a notch better than most, and more than adequate although repetitive every day. We liked the very short 5 min. walk from Bourbon Street to the hotel which allowed us to leave the noise behind. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Will de d
Reviews.Content: The quality Inn & Suites in Downtown New Orleans is worth a stay. The staff is among the most pleasant I have ever encountered and extremely professional and helpful, The size of the room is alright for a hotel downtown. The bathroom is a bit small. The breakfast (simple eggs, cereal, waffle's, coffee, tea, juices) is included in the roomrate. The hotel is less than ten minutes away from Bourbon street and it is a easy walk. The streetcar at Canal street is also nearby. New Orleans is a great place to visit. Not only for the jazz-music, but there is so much more to see. I only had three nights there, but I could have easely entertained myself for two weeks, As with all tourist destinations, prices for hotels, food and drinks on average are a bit higher than usual in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to Stay Again if in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: elsiefromga
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very convenient location - a short walk to Canal Street (maybe 1-1/2 blocks) and then a short distance to Bourbon Street (maybe 2 blocks). My wife and I had a reservation for an economy room with AARP rate and requesting a quiet part of hotel. We arrived after 11 PM and the nice guy at the front desk, George, took note of our quiet-room request and searched for changes he could make to the room assignment. I think the hotel wasn't full and he upgraded us to a larger room which seemed to be in a good location. The next morning there was a very nice complimentary hot/cold breakfast buffet with most anything one could want including waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, cereal, and multiple beverages. The staff seemed alert to diners' needs because, without my asking, they helped me first with my waffle and later with something else. I thought the price for the covered parking garage (about 1/2 block away) was a little steep but we had only one night in New Orleans and asked George if our car could remain in the garage until after room checkout time the next day. He said it would be okay, so that made the $17 (plus two valet tips) seem not bad. While checking out, I heard the manager talking on the phone with someone about discounting the parking fee but I didn't pursue discounting ours considering that we were able to leave the car in the garage after checkout time and because we thought the total overall cost of our stay was reasonable. We checked out around 11 AM and the hotel kept our bags in their office until we showed up with the car to retrieve them about 3:30 PM. The middle-aged fellow who helped us get the bags to our car seemed like a very nice fellow as was the manager and all staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room”
Reviews.Author: abletokhuna
Reviews.Content: The staff is truly outstanding from the desk to the porters; probably the best I have experienced. Excellent value and location is easily walkable to the French Quarter and the street car. The continental breakfast is serviceable and the room amenities are just right for the room cost. The absence of a restaurant and bar in this food rich city is not missed. Airport transportation is just around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: DhKhan
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at a very reasonable cost compared to other hotels in New Orleansm specially during a festival weekend.. We were there during the Satchmo Festival August 5-7 (and an extra 2 days after that). Were upgraded to a bigger room at check-in with out even asking so that was a great start. Staff was always very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was very nice with a good selection, better than most hotels in it's class. Free WiFi worked great in the room and in the lobby. It's a small hotel, so does not have a big lobby or fancy entrance, but on the place side it takes only a minute or two to get from the entrance to the rooms. Has a Subway connected to the lobby (open till 5 pm only on weekdays, 3 pm weekends) and a Starbucks round the corner in the Wyndham hotel. Great location too, walking distance to the street cars and buses and also the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the popular tourist spots, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cymbolz
Reviews.Content: It doesnâ€™t look like much outside, but inside is very nice with decent room size (I think I had an upgrade which was nice) and very friendly staff (that was the key to me giving this 5 stars). I enjoyed my stay and will stay again. Internet worked fine, and breakfast was adequate (hot options, and a good easy start to the day). It is just a two block walk to Bourbon St and only a block away from Canal St. If you are female and on your own, you might want to exercise caution at night as it is down a less frequented street after dusk. But I felt fine and safe (single male). The gym was ok but too basic (need some weights or machines, not just treadmills).

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Zion33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on tripadvisor recommendations and they were quite accurate. There was a mix up with our room so they bent over backwards to fix it. I am a clean freak but this older hotel suited me just fine. Beware of the $17 parking fee though. Overall a great rate for a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes indeed.”
Reviews.Author: Kevlondon
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2-night stay here based solely on its TripAdvisor rating, and we weren't disappointed. After a long drive down from Memphis, we were welcomed, upgraded and checked in and then shown the way to the parking garage, all of 50 yards past the hotel. Our smoking suite on the 9th floor was nice and spacious, bizarrely none of the windows can be opened so you are relying on the aircon to clear the smoke - not ideal. Yes, this is just one step up from a motel so some things are a little shabby - the net curtains in the room were filthy, and the windows themselves are dirty and look badly finished. But the core product is absolutely fine - floors and bedding are clean, furniture is in good condition, and the breakfast is a small step above the average due to the availability of hot food. Unfortunately the juice machine was broken and no alternative was available. However, as with previous reviews, it's the staff that make this place. They are abundantly friendly, happy to chat and full of useful information too. Considering the number of soulless chain hotels in the vicinity, this is a very good option if you're on a budget or you want something a little different. Just a block from Canal Street and 3 blocks from Bourbon, the location is ideal and seems safe enough. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are all true. Great hotel & celiac friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: PrairieRover
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Quality Inn & Suites on O'Keefe Avenue in New Orleans, and I'm very happy to recommend it to anyone travelling there. While the decor may not be the newest or trendiest, the location, convenience and price are just great. I was able to upgrade from a double room to a double suite upon request, for no extra charge - and this was in the middle of a large conference that had pretty much snapped up all available hotel space in the city. Having the suite made the difference to myself and my sister, who is still recovering from a difficult surgery and appreciated the privacy of a separate bedroom. The fully-equipped kitchenette was also a welcome surprise and helped us to beat the cost of eating out every day. The best part of the hotel is definitely the staff and service. Everyone really does go the extra mile to make sure that your stay is comfortable. I can especially recommend front desk clerk Blair, who went out of his way to purchase gluten-free breakfast items for me from the local supermarket (which was *not* added to my bill). I was astonished to be handed a bag of assorted GF goodies upon checkin. That gesture took a lot of anxiety out of my stay, which any celiac can appreciate. (BTW for excellent GF dinners, visit Domenica restaurant in the nearby Roosevelt Hotel) Front desk staff were also wonderful in recommending tours, and in arranging airport transport. Would I stay there again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people - less than wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: kbrownlee
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews, and while we did, indeed find the staff very courteous and delightful (they were alway polite and helpful), there isn't much they could have done for the hard beds, leaky faucets, and broken safe. Pros: - Average (but free!) hotel breakfast: continental offerings plus eggs, grits, a meat, and a waffle maker - Courteous, polite staff (I'm not sure I could say that enough - they were very good!) -Clean, decent accomodations and decor -Within walking distance of French Quarter and streetcar lines -Felt safe -Subway restaurant right next door (we didn't use it, but someone might!) Cons: -The bed was as hard as a dry river bed at the end of a 100-year drought - we could not sleep and got up in pain every morning. We almost changed hotels for this one reason. It actually affected our ability to enjoy our trip, because we hurt too much to walk everywhere! That's how bad they were. (And we're pretty healthy, well-exercised people!) -The bathroom faucet leaked all over the counter constantly -The bathroom ceiling tiles were offset and the ceiling fixtures rusty -We're used to sleeping with a fan running (white noise), but there was no "fan" in the bedroom. The AC control is in the living room of the suite, and it was quiet (ok, ok... I know, I 'm complaining about a hotel room being quiet at night?? Sheesh!) Overall, a nice place in the daytime, but we would not be able to stay there again because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a believer! This is truly the best hotel in N.O.!”
Reviews.Author: Castleblanca
Reviews.Content: I know what you're saying. How can a Quality Inn be the best hotel in New Orleans. I mean, with hotels like the J.W. Marriott, the Intercontinental, etc.. I mean, hotels which cost 3 and 4 times what the Quality Inn costs ---- how can it really be the best. The answer is simple: the staff. Oh, to be sure, the rooms are really nice and comfy. And the location a block off Canal Street is an easy two minute walk to Bourbon Street or the St. Charles Avenue streetcar. And the price is easy on the wallet for New Orleans. However, the staff make this one most enjoyable hotel to stay in. This trip was different, because I was making a couple different stays there (with time in between). Upon checking in, the first time, they immediately commented on how I would be returning shortly for another stay. And when I did return for the next stay, I didn't even have to give my name to the reception desk clerk. She recognized me, greeted me, and brought up my new reservation --- all without having to ask my name. She remembered it! No, she remembered "me"! Furthermore, my second check-in was an "early check-in" (about 12:30pm). Most hotels will give the arriving guest the perfunctory reply and say something about how one has to wait until 3:00pm or whatever. Well, that is not what happens at this Quality Inn. They immediately checked with housekeeping, and the manager,himself, promptly went upstairs to check on rooms to find a nice room for my early check-in. He came back, told the desk clerk which room to give me, and when I opened the door to the room the lights were turned on to give a "proper greeting". Now, that's impressive! And when I checked out to leave New Orleans and go to the airport, the manager, who was on the phone, cupped the phone so as to not talk to the person on the other end of the line, and said good-bye to me (by name) and thanked me for staying with them. Over the decades I have stayed in several hotels in New Orleans ---- mainly in the French Quarter. And I have returned to a couple of them, because they were/are nice. However, this Quality Inn will be where I lay my head on my next visit to New Orleans. Trust this and other reviews. This Quality Inn in truly the best hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “NO best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler-peach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Essence fest and enjoyed every bit of our stay. The hotel is located in a great location and less than a 5 min walk to canal and french qtr. The staff were really nice and very accomomodating. We will definitely go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: viajepasyal
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel is old but that for the price, I wasn't expecting a lot. I was pleasantly surprised. The bed was comfortable, clean, bathroom spotless. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and made us feel very welcome. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: Winyah
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the location ... it's close to a streetcar stop and convenient to the French Quarter. How's the room ... it's comfortable and equipped with just about everything anyone could need ... a refrigerator, microwave, desk, sofa, iron and ironing board, and hairdryer. And what about the service ... well, it's fantastic! From the minute you walk in the door until the time you check out, you are greeted warmly and treated like family by the entire staff! When you factor in the delicious complimentary breakfast consisting of scrambled eggs, grits, freshly-made waffles, bagels, bacon, sausage, cereal, toast, juice, and coffee ... it's an exceptional value as well. It's really no surprise this hotel is rated #1 ... it's well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, rooms OK, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Johnjx
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, but a good value. My room actually had no window which was a little strange and somewhat disconcerting, so you may wish to ask about that when you check in. But the staff were very helpful and went out of their way to improve my stay. When I complained about the small pillows, they bought me a new, bigger one still in the bag.

Reviews.Title: “best place, best location great service”
Reviews.Author: aamoun
Reviews.Content: you cant beat the place close to everything clean and great customer service. we got there early and were able to check in with an upgrade to a 2 rooms. breakfast was awesome and plenty....we will stay there again for sure. thanks to Dada he was great

Reviews.Title: “We can't say enough good things about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: seniortrvlr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and were pleased each time. Each time the front desk staff have been helpful and pleasant. The rooms have all been clean and well equipped. The free breakfast is varied and quite complete. And the distance to the French Quarter is close enough to easily walk, but far enough to be quiet. We would recommend it to anyone traveling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TxOffWeGo
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night over the Memorial Day weekend this year. We picked this hotel based on the reviews here on TA and we were not disappointed. As others have said, the location is great--just a short walk from the French Quarter and Jackson Square but away from the noise and hustle and bustle. The staff and management could not have been nicer--upon check-in we found that we had been upgraded to slightly larger rooms and that the rooms were connecting which is nice for family travel. Privacy for all but access if needed. The breakfast was fine. Parking was easy. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel50S
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property located two blocks from the French Quarter. It has the amenities one expects from this chain - clean secure rooms at reasonable prices, comfortable beds. The complimentary breakfast is better than usual for a Comfort property. What set the place apart for me was the extraordinary staff. They were always friendly and helpful, without being intrusive. When we arrived they gave us walking directions for the places we wanted to see, along with tips to help assure our safety. The people here were.... great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as always”
Reviews.Author: harleyman48
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a quick weekend getaway. As usual, we stayed at this hotel. We just love everything about this hotel. From the "cold" hotel room, which you will love if you visit in the summer, to the outstanding and friendly staff, one can not find better accomadations for the price. Great location and as already stated, you will never find better staff. We never stay anywhere else while visiting our beloved New Orleans. Try it and see if you do not agree with us.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: jarkkonieminen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2011. We arrived after being in transit for 40 hours and were thoroughly looked after on arrival. The hospitality at this hotel is amazing and such a great location, only 5 mins walk from the French qtr.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Totosma
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and quiet. Employees were friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. Within walking distance to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, great value”
Reviews.Author: reggert
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hotel staff, their attention to detail and willingness to help was second to none. Rooms were clean and comfy, a minor plumbing issue was quickly addressed. The "free" breakfast was excellent and hit the spot. Very quiet area, a couple of blocks from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I took the train to New Orleans and spent one night. This was the perfect hotel for such a trip -- walking distance from the train station, walking distance to anything in the French Quarter, quiet, friendly, clean, comfortable. Because this was just a one-night trip and I knew I was going to be busy the whole time, I did something extremely rare for me: I didn't take my computer. I did take my iPad and iPhone and found WiFi connectivity in my room a problem. It would claim I was connected, but then the connection would vanish, leaving me on 3G. If I had been staying longer and had had my regular computer with me, that problem would have caused my rating of the hotel to drop from the top level to the bottom. I trust it was just a temporary glitch since I can't imagine a hotel this good not having decent net connectivity (whether WiFi or wired).

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: edmundHumberside
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal base for a 5 day convention. I was upgraded without making any request and at my previously booked price. As everyone says, the staff were universally helpful and the breakfast varied enough for most people. My room was quiet despite overlooking the road outside and the bed restful. I would have liked a restaurant for dinner but there were several on nearby Canal and Bourbon Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: TnC_on_Tour
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here during Jazzfest & had a fantastic time. The staff fell over themselves to help, all really friendly. This was absolutely a standout hotel of the 15 nights we spent on this roadtrip. I can't think of a hotel where I've had better service.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoamingD
Reviews.Content: No bells and whistles here, but a really outstanding staff and a nice hotel. Location is good. Only 2 blocks or so from Canal, which has lots of locals shops like shoe stores, a Walgreens & CVS ... Very convenient. Upon arrival, a staff member raced to the curb to secure our luggage from the cabbie. When we asked for suggestions of things to do/places to eat, they promised to put together a packet for us and bring it up, which they did within an hour. The room was small but had every amenity we would need, with the exception of wireless internet. Otherwise, a microwave, refrigerator, nice-sized bathroom... We were greeted by staff on each entry and exit, the elevators were held open when they saw us coming. And overall, a quiet hotel. We heard nothing! Which is a lot to say in New Orleans. We were close enough to walk to Bourbon St, but also outside its calamity. Though there was no room service or restaurant, they did serve a decent breakfast buffet. Overall, a great experience. The staff really helped make this a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service without the 5 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: TriangleGirl
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel with an impressive lobby and room service, this isn't it. However, if you're looking for a hotel with a fabulous location, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a great price, this is the one you want. Oh, and you'll be treated like a VIP here, even if you're paying for the cheapest room they have. We stayed Wednesday night through Friday night and were upgraded from a queen room to a king room at no extra charge. Everything we asked for was provided quickly and with a smile. Every member of the staff we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and seemed to love serving their customers. The location for this hotel couldn't be beat. It's about 4 blocks from Bourbon St. (far enough away so it's not noisy) and within an easy walk from some of the best restaurants in New Orleans. Plus, it's close to the Streetcar lines, which will take you to many of the best parts of the city. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great service, great location, and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Verlia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommended for any length of stay. My husband and I checked in on the last day of the Jazz Fest and were immediately upgraded to a suite at no additional charge without asking. All of the front desk personnel are wonderful, but especially the manager Stanley and Blair. Blair went out of his way to get me something I was looking for on his own time. They gave us maps and advice any time we asked a question. We would most definitely stay here again without question. The housekeeping was somewhat lacking but all we had to do is call the front desk and it was immediately taken care of. To use the internet you had to sit in the lobby, though. The free hot breakfast is simple but satisfactory. The location is quiet and easy to get to the streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Price.”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: I would agree with all of the positive comments, I loved it. The location to the french Quarter made it an easy walk to the nightlife and to pick up the tours during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: PlainsWoman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the St. Regis and the Four Seasons in NYC, and we enjoyed our stay at the Quality Inn far more! The parking garage next to the hotel is NOT the hotel's; their parking garage is across the street. Only quibble. The staff were absolutely outstanding! Polite, friendly and helpful. They greeted us by name coming and going over the course of our 2 stays. The only thing they didn't do that a concierge does is to actually make reservations for us. Mr. Stanley, the manager, was very helpful to us in getting us a reservation for the return leg of our journey during March madness. That was a real kindness, since I had forgotten to make that reservation when I made the original arrival reservation. We arrived early and asked to put our luggage in storage as we explored - they put us into a king suite instead! Beautifully appointed room with a kitchenette area. The bed was comfortable with a choice of pillows and crisp linens. The work area was well appointed. WiFi seems to depend on the room you get - first 1/2 of the trip was great, second 1/2 not so great. Continental Breakfast was an absolute delight - many choices of yogurt, cheese, eggs, grits (of course!), bacon, breads, pastries, cereals, oatmeal, waffles, etc., etc. Our breakfasts kept us satisfied until mid-afternoon. Close to a convenience store (The Brothers - 2 blocks away - recommend for snacks and alcoholic beverages, rather than the Bourbon Street-area vendors.) About 6 blocks away from the French Quarter proper, which meant that the rooms themselves were nice and quiet. 2 blocks to streetcar line (St. Charles) and 4 blocks to another (Cemeteries, etc.) Parking is $17/day - valet parking, so bring change for tips.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply average”
Reviews.Author: jybay
Reviews.Content: Don't ask me how this place gets its rave reviews. Yes, the Reception staff are friendly but personally I'd rather have a clean room. The bathroom was dirty with old hair in the basin plughole. When I dropped the soap on the floor, it came up covered with long brown hairs. Well, I'm a blonde and my husband has a crew cut.... Towels were old and stained. The room itself was a good size with comfortable beds but the decor was old-fashioned and glooomy with a very strong smell of furniture polish. Reception staff were friendly but the porter literally tried to grap my husband's suitcase out of his hands even after he had said that he preferred to wheel it himself. On the plus side, the location is excellent; less that 5 minutes' walk to the French Quarter. All in all, a resounding "OK".

Reviews.Title: “Stanley the manager makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: SG1979077
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviewes and I must say that we were not disappointed. First things first. Stanley, the manager of this hotel and his team makes all the difference in your stay. We had booked the hotel through one of the travel sites (travelocity) and we ended up getting one king bed instead of two queens-which we wanted because my brother was joining us. We tried making this change through the site (travelocity) multiple times but no success. My wife called the hotel and spoke to Stanley the day of our departure. Surprise surprise he said he will take care of it and taking care is exactly what he does. From check in to check out and everything in between, he makes a genuine effort to make your stay pleasant. He hand his staff give you the famous New Orleans big easy feel and make you feel at home. Having said that, I noticed a few negative reviews about this hotel and I think the root cause for these is setting up the wrong expectations This hotel is NOT a Westin or Ritz Carlton or something like that. This is a place where you get a very good and safe location (walking/tram distiance to all attractions like the French Qaurter, Borbon Street etc.), decent accomodation, and great service at a relatively cheap price. So, if Westin-like hotels is your preference, this hotel is NOT for you. In fact, if you are willing to shell out about 50 to 100 dollars more than the rates for this Quality Inn, you can get a room in much 'nicer' hotels in the area. But as far as getting the service like Stanley's personal touch- good luck with that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at hostel prices.”
Reviews.Author: Muesli_f
Reviews.Content: We booked based on the positive reviews and were very happy with the standard. As we are on a budget, we'd looked at hostels and cheap B&Bs but they all seemed to have a lot of negative reviews and difficult locations. The location of the hotel was excellent. In a safe area but just outside the french quarter. We walked in every day. It's also great as you can get a cab without getting stuck in the traffic of the French Quarter. Service was excellent. All staff were so friendly, all the time, ready to help and eager to hear about your day. Room was very clean and housekeeping came everyday. I would stay here again in a flash-BEST VALUE IN NEW ORLEANS!!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Atkins
Reviews.Content: Only 2.5 star rated Hotel but with such accomodating staff, clean rooms and away from Bourban Street - it's a very good place to stay. A free breakfast with room, Checking in early was no problem and we even got a room upgrade to a suite. Once again thanks to Stanley and his team - this was real service, not the pretend stuff you often get in Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: goinggray
Reviews.Content: One block off Canal Street and the French Quarter, this is a great hotel for exploring New Orleans. We arrived by taxi from the airport, the taxi driver was heavily pregnant and unable to help with the luggage, but a friendly porter scuttled out to help us check-in and show us to our room. (Unrequested upgrade from a Queen to a Suite, thankyou!) It was a damp night and we asked where we could eat - he recommended Deany's (two blocks over, one down) and he was right, its a great inexpensive diner (& maybe not so inexpensive casino!). Complimentary breakfast was comprehensive, lots of choices, and we noticed that it continued long after the advertised hours. (well done!) Walk down Bourbon Street once, then forget it. It's a tacky, over-priced mess. But the rest of the French Quarter is well worth exploring, particularly down by the waterside where the French doughnuts (beignets) at Cafe du Monde are both inexpensive & irrististible. Take the St Charles Street Car out to the Garden Quarter, you can just imagine those Southern Belles sipping a mint julep on the porches of the wooden mansions.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe it's ranked so high”
Reviews.Author: Arkale
Reviews.Content: definitely not for a business trip. I made a mistake and ignored the criticizing reviews. The only good thing I can mention is the nice welcoming and helpful staff. Yet it's not enough to overcome all the shortcomings of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: CorncobOBiscuit
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a decent hotel to stay overnight in New Orleans before a cruise. Based on reviews and location, I chose this place, figuring it would just be a clean place to rest my head but not expecting much else. It was definitely more upscale than I expected, and for the price. Staff was very friendly from arrival to check-out. Our whole group was upgraded to suites with kitchenettes and living rooms, and George at the front desk helped us plan out our evening in New Orleans. The location is fantastic-the French Quarter is easily within walking distance, but far enough that you can sleep soundly in peace and quiet. Complimentary breakfast was not only edible, but also tasty. Before we we even checked out, my wife and I agreed that this is the place we'll stay the next time we're in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingBanshee
Reviews.Content: Ditto with everyone's comments. This place is the best deal out there. It's definitely not a 5 star hotel but it is perfectly fine for a great stay in a great city. The management and staff are helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable, the breakfasts are more than adequate with hot items too (sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs), and the location is just ideal - within easy walking distance to everything. To top this all off, the rates are so reasonable too. The rate for one of our evenings was considerably higher than the rest of our evenings but the hotel had no problem adjusting the rate to make it consistent with the rest of our stay. We very much appreciated that. We got lucky booking the last available rooms for the week we were visiting and we are so pleased we did.

Reviews.Title: “Stanley, the manager, is my hero!”
Reviews.Author: Assisy
Reviews.Content: WOW, The most amazing service, made me feel that I stayed in a 5 star hotel or better! Stanley, the manager, greeted us and remembered our names for the rest of the stay. He took care of us and really made everything to make sure our stay was excellente. The room was clean, big and very nice. Perfect location and we felt very safe walking home(about 10 minutes) from the French district at night. We enjoyed our stay so much we decided to extend our stay. Thank you Quality Inn and Stanley for a lovely time in Nola. ( A lot of hotel could learn a lot from this one when it comes to customer service).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bproy
Reviews.Content: We have to totally agree with the previous review.We stayed the night prior to our cruise departure out of New Orleans and our stay was top notch. Many thanks to the dedicated hotel staff. We will defininitely return...hopefully one day very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaSoonergrl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night through an online booking. I called the hotel a few days later just to confirm that they had our 3 rooms with 2 beds in each room. Apparently the description that I read from the online site was actually 3 rooms with one double bed in each. The manager Stanley was very polite and helpful. He said we will get the rooms that I needed and not to worry. Thankfully our stay was for a few days after Mardi Gras and Stanley and his staff worked to secure the beds that I needed no matter what the reservation said and didn't charge me extra. The hotel was clean, rooms were perfect in size, and the free continental breakfast was great. Everyone was polite and helpful and made sure we had a pleasant stay. The hotel's location is perfect. We were taking a cruise our of New Orleans and this hotel is about one mile from the terminal. The next time I go to New Orleans I plan on staying here again. Thanks to Stanley and his staff for their hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Everything that the reviewers say about this hotel is true !”
Reviews.Author: lkhagen123
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY recommend this hotel! It is only a few blocks from the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Harrah's, and the riverfront. The staff at this hotel are AMAZING--always willing to help in any way possible. Upon arrival, our hotel room was upgraded to a suite, parking was only $14/night, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I could not have asked for a better experience. If you stay here, and I hope you do, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “If you travel to New Orleans, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladyonfire
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for Mardi Gras, and I was amazed by the phenomenal staff. I was traveling with a couple, and myself, and all the rooms we could find online was a single queen sized bed, and was noted that there wouldn't be enough room for a cot, so I brought a pile of blankets, pillows, and a sleeping bag ready to crash on the floor! The night I checked in, the man at the front desk looked at his computer after taking my name, then looking at my friends and I. He got this worried look on his face, and said "You can only fit two people in this room, and there's three of you." I told him it was fine, and I came prepared to sleep on the floor. He just shook his head and said "I'm sorry, I can't allow that." I started to panic because we didn't have the money to get another room, and while I was having an internal panic attack, he looked up from his computer and said "We have an open suite available. We're going to upgrade you to that for no extra cost. I just wouldn't feel good letting any of you sleep on the floor". AMAZING. Then we met our bellhop, who was another extraordinary human. He was SO friendly, and was ready to help up with anything we needed. I felt like I was seeing a favorite uncle or something. After he helped up get our luggage to our suite (awesome), he walked us down the block to show us where the parking garage was, then pointed us towards Bourbon Street, and places to get some food. Then made a list for us of places he preferred to eat at. He was a peach. Every time we took the elevator down to leave, everyone at the front desk wished us a safe, and good time, and every time we returned, they would ask us if we had fun, and if there was anything we had questions about. They all gracefully tolerated, and enthusiastically answered our ignorant tourist questions, from walking and driving directions, to food and bar recommendations, to basic local culture and history. The complimentary continental breakfast was surprisingly very good, and tasty. It was worth dragging our butts out of bed just for the yum breakfast. Canal Street and Bourbon were just a couple blocks away (walking distance), and a corner store half a block away, as well as standard fast food face (Subway, McDonald's, etc...) The staff enhanced our stay in New Orleans 10 fold, and will definitely stay there again when I go back. I STRONGLY suggest you stay there if you want somewhere comfortable, friendly, reasonably priced, and withing close walking distance of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy for the $ anywhere”
Reviews.Author: sueanniesue
Reviews.Content: I just loved my stay at the Quality Inn and Suites last night. My husband, myself and our two college age sons stayed in 2 rooms. We were there to see a Hormets game and the Arena and Superdome were just blocks away. The staff was the best ever based on my previous traveling experiences. This is not a 5 star hotel, but for what it is and the price, it''s the best bargain in New Orleans. I was somewhat worried as one reviewer was afraid of the neighborhood. I was with 3 large men but I would not have been afraid if I was with girl friends. The area is well traveled and I saw no transients. Mr. Stanley the general manager upgraded both my room and our sons' room to suites at no additional charge. Parking was close and was only $14 a day, I have paid $30 at the Doubletree and Sheraton. I plan to return there in June as some old college buddies are getting together. We will all be staying at the Quality Inn and I know we will have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereWannaDoThat
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great staff at Quality Inn. Everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to help us secure cabs several times....not an easy task during Mardi Gras parades. Room was clean and he location is great ..........you just can't beat the price. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff may be more important than location”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwise__traveller
Reviews.Content: This is the best Quality Inn I've ever stayed at. Amazing location, nice rooms, good breakfast, but the staff is the key. I've stayed at 4-5 star hotels that couldn't match this staffs attentiveness, friendliness and overall good character. Whoever's in charge of the HR, you should be commended. This is how every hotel should be run.

Reviews.Title: “True Quality Hotel, Great Value, Perfect Location, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: sandmriley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Hotel & Suites New Orleans over Presidents Weekend and cannot recommend them high enough. Although we arrived at 930am (and naturally could not check-in to our room for that night) we were welcomed and offerred complimentary breakfast and the use of all the facilities until our room was ready later that day. The reception staff could not have helped us any more they answered all our questions and promised to call us once our room was ready. Sure enough around 3pm they called apologising that the room we had booked was not available yet and advised us that they would upgrade us to a suite ! When we returned we checked in. Such a smooth easy process from the great friendly staff. Our suite was amazing. A small kitchen with microwave, sink and fridge, bathroom, separate bedroom from the lounge area, and Two tv's Most importantly the bed was very comfortable and the room nice and quiet and very clean and inviting. The location of the hotel is great, less than a 5 minute walk to the french quarter and away from all the noise. Friends that we were travelling with were all complaining that their hotels located in the quarter were noisy. The daily breakfast included in the room rate was also fantastic. Waffles, toast, bagels, cereal, coffee, pastries, eggs, bacon, muffins, juice, fruit and much much more. ....... Most importantly the best thing about the hotel is the service. All the staff go out of their way to help you, and are genuine in their caring about you having a great holiday. They go above and beyond to make sure you know all the little secrets of the city, from buying tickets on the streetcar, to advice on what to see and do and eat. If you are looking for quality and great service you cant go past this hotel. Like the name suggests.....its a Quality Hotel ! We would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans. We loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Go that extra mile”
Reviews.Author: sheelOttawa
Reviews.Content: Arrived off ship late morning for a 2day stay of new Orleans. Offered us our rooms if we wanted to wait 25 min. Upgraded us to King Size. Very friendly front desk staff. Continental breakfast excellent even included scrambled eggs, sausage and waffles. Staff in the dining room very efficient and personable. Location to Bourbon St. very close by as further into the French Quarter about a 10 min. walk. Hotel is older and not modern but had a lovely upgraded bathroom. It is not a luxury hotel but if looking for a comfortable place to stay we all enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “A great value and an excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: kampeskaboater
Reviews.Content: A fiine hotel in a great location. Very friendly and helpful staff. Super breakfast. Very clean lobby, dining area, and suite. Parking arrangements were excellent. Great value for a major tourist city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, clean, well located, friendly staff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: saba-taba
Reviews.Content: I recently shared a room with a friend during our recent attendance at a meeting in New Orleans.The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.. The breakfast was very good.; the rooms were clean. We were given a room with almost separate queen beds.Each "room" had its own TV., And the location 3 blooks from the French quarter couldn't be better. The convention center is about a mile away, but that makes for a nice brisk morning walk

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION AND BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: calatoru
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel reasonable priced,good location close to French Quartier and Ernst MOrial Convention center.All informations available at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, comfortable rooms, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: spanishfoodlova
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great central location. Good spot in between Magazine Street and Bourbon Street. Front desk service very friendly and informative. I'll stay there again if I make it back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, staff and breakfast at great price.”
Reviews.Author: walklookshoot
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here the past couple of Mardi Gras. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. The breakfast is exceptional for the price of the room. Once they meet you, the staff remembers you forever! Am writing this review late,(January 2011) because we recently stayed at an upscale hotel in NO and it paled in comparison. Upscale was not nearly as comfortable, nor was the service as good--and no breakfast included. Hope to stay at Quality Inn New Orleans again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge this book by its cover. Inside, this place is great.”
Reviews.Author: Three-men-and-a-babe
Reviews.Content: If I had seen this place from the outside without reading its reviews, I would have passed it by. But I'm glad that I didn't. To begin with, the staff was very friendly and helpful. They take a lot of time with you when you have questions about the area. One guy even had an inventive way of opening wine bottles when asked. The rooms were very comfortable with a fridge and microwave. One person in our group got a mini-suite which gave the group a small sitting room to visit in. The location was great. We were only a few blocks away from Bourbon Street and a couple of blocks away from a CVS. Really, to get some rest at night, I wouldn't want to be any closer to Bourbon Street. Breakfast had good choices including some hot foods: eggs, grits, waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Super service, Full Breakfast, and close to Trolley and French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoo1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove from Tampa, Florida to spend five days with my brother-in-law who flew in from Boston. I saw the #2 rating on Trip Advisor and read the testimonials. Very accurate high rating. These folks can't do enough for you. The beds were very comfortable. They match or exceed the bedding in some of the fancier places I've stayed in. The hotel is very clean. Location is really handy to everything. You can walk to the French Quarter. It's very close to the trolley as well. The parking rate was cheaper than the other hotels I checked out. What a GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, conveniently located, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: delsolseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night....liked our room, breakfast, and location of the hotel. We stayed out late, and felt safe walking back to our hotel from Bourbon Street. The staff was friendly and very helpful in giving us directions to different places we wanted to visit. Although we weren't in town long enough to use it, there is a Subway restaurant connected to the hotel. Parking was also convenient (parking structure 1/2 block away with valet service). The hotel as well as the area was not busy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Say”
Reviews.Author: Jaci O
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Stanley and ALL the staff at Quality Inn & Suites, we really enjoyed our stay in New Orleans (attended the Sugar Bowl). Quiet, clean and close to Bourbon St (about 3 blocks) and close to Superdome (all within walking distance). If you plan a trip to New Orleans I highly recommend staying at the Quality Inn & Suites (210 O'Keefe). A good breakfast is also included. The price for a room is much more affordable than others in the area. ALL the staff will make you feel like family!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: harleyman48
Reviews.Content: We were down in NOLA for some R & R, and as usual we stayed at our favorte hotel, I am still amazed at what an outstanding hotel this is. Sure, there are others that are nicer, better location, and maybe cater to the higher elite traveler, however rest assured that none, and I emphasis, None, that will provide you with the guest services that this staff does on a day by day basis. We are treated as if we are truly important, and that does not happen often when you stay in other hotels. I can not say enough good things about this hotel and the entire staff. We will be back for New Years, and guess what, this is exactly where we will be. Take it from a couple who travel quite frequently; it does not get better than this hotel. OUTSTANDING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have to tip my hat to these N'Orlan's folk!”
Reviews.Author: WHOI
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden treasure, and offers the same amenities that others offer, but for a better price. I've enjoyed all of our stays here at the Quality Inn (on O'Keefe St.) and have to say, they really go out of their way to help make the stay warm, friendly, and like you are part of their family. Stanley (Manager) always welcomes you each morning, as well as George and others who offer their smiles, as well as information on where to go, or how to get somewhere. If you are planning on going to New Orleans, this place is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with location, great prices and super service”
Reviews.Author: Puggy1128
Reviews.Content: We have never been disappointed with the Quality Inn in downtown New Orleans.. Their friendly, helpful staff, nice rooms with frig., micro, and coffee makers and great location within walking distance of French Quarter, catch a trolley 1 blk away to sightsee the Garden District and shopping at the waterfront and French Mkt. until you drop. We stayed 3 nights and waking up to a nice full breakfast included with the cost of the room was a great start to each day. Mr. Stanley the manager and his well trained, friendly staff are always ready to help you and make sure you have a great time ... We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Patsy201
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights but liked it. So close to everything. Could walk to Bourbon Street. Street car to the Zoo was one block over. Street car to the Cemetary was one block away. Street car to the waterfront was one block away. Hotel was clean. Staff was very nice, helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent. Nice selection. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Quality Inn & Suites Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: booler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had another great stay at this property, this time with her mother. The middle foyer rooms make it perfect for traveling with family and friends as there is really two rooms (one of the queen size beds is in a room with a door) which provides two separate sleeping quarters. As in 2009 the staff was outstanding, especially the manager Stanley. The hotel is only a short walk to Bourbon Street and we always felt very safe, even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Houstonian19
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice near the French Quarter (3 blocks). Our room was quiet, affordable and clean. Also, it has the best staff I have ever had anywhere! When we arrived late at night, they quickly checked us in and helped us park (block away) They were right there whenever we needed anything and they even let us check out late so we could go by the WWII museum again (a quick street car ride away) They honestly made us feel that they were delighted to have us stay there. Kudos to George, Kendrell, Mr. Art and everyone else for exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Best value - luxury not included”
Reviews.Author: PegEggHead
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. There were a few quirky things that occured such as the housekeeper kept taking all our soap (used and new) and would leave us with none. After the first 2 days I would get soap from the front desk and hide the unused one for the next day. Weird! During breakfast on the last day we were there there was an "altercation" between a staff member and another person who came in off the street. There was a lot of screaming and shoving, but the front desk staff came around to restrain their staff member and the other guy left. Again...weird! But it is New Orleans. If you need a place close to the French Quarter and other activtiesto get a goods night sleep then this hotel will meet your needs. It was clean and the staff were overall helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Marynell L
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service! Everyone was very friendly and extremely customer oriented. Helpful and polite. The rooms were very clean. Very good value. Walking distance to the French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great fit for good value and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: DaveR53
Reviews.Content: Althgouth the rooms were a bit small (like most in NOLA), our rooms were meticulous and the hotel staff was superb in making sure we had everything we needed to ensure a pleasant stay. Close and convenient to the Superdome, French Quarter, etc. We'll definitely would return there when staying in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmc2632
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in New Orleans in March and really had a nice stay at this hotel. Our room was very large and comfortable and relaxing to come back to after long days out on the town. The location was great. It was a block off of Canal Street- perfect walking distance to get down to the French Quarter easily, yet a nice quiet place to "go home" to. The traffic/car horns outside the window were a little annoying at night, but that's to be expected in a city, and once I was to sleep, it didn't matter! I was a little concerned about the safety of the location before we got there, but after being there and walking back there every night, it was totally fine with nothing to worry about. Staff was excellent and very friendly and helpful. The breakfast each morning was divine- a great mix of healthy food and classics like waffles, warm eggs, and sausage. Would gladly stay here again if we get to come back to New Orleans. The only complaint I have (and is not directly related to the hotel) is the parking availability nearby. There are a few parking garages. The one that the hotel recommends I think was $15/night. They were okay, but the workers were largely incompetent. They required valet service and parked all the cars in 3-5 deep. So, it took us on average about 15-30 minutes each morning to have our car extracted...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: 2logcabin
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our stay in New Orleans. The Quality Inn made our trip! The location is good. It is a little away from Bourbon but within walking distance. We walked there everyday. It is away from the noise of the busy streets and crowds. Canal Street is right around the corner. Also it easy to get to the streetcars and buses. We didn't rent a car and really didn't need one. (Tip-get a Jazzy pass while you are there) What sets Quality Inn apart from other hotels is the staff. Everyday we were greeted and recognized by the staff. There was always someone to welcome you home. The manager was especially helpful from the moment we walked in til the time we left. The room we reserved was not ready for our early arrival and he gave us a complimentary upgrade. Many hotels just make you wait for the room you reserved. The breakfast is also great!! I used Tripadvisor to choose this hotel and I highly recommend the good value and service this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: RoboNole
Reviews.Content: I was here on business that also fell during the annual Voodoo festival at Halloween. Despite all of the craziness in town the hotel staff was super. They went all out to make sure that my stay was comfortable and provided all the information that I needed to get around town. The location was only about three blocks off of Bourbon St. and close enough that I walked everywhere. Business at the conference center and meals in the quarter were all an easy walk. I would stay here again with out question.

Reviews.Title: “Proof that great service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: lostinharlem
Reviews.Content: The manager and front desk staff treated us, and all the guests, like royalty over the course of our stay. During long weekend stay, the manager made reservations at 4 different restaurants for us, opened up the fitness center during off-hours so we could sneak in a late night work-out, and ran through countless city maps with us. Although the rooms were fairly basic the suites were very large and the maid service was always very on target. The location was one of my favorite aspects of the hotel. It was a couple of blocks into downtown, between the French Quarter and Garden District, and was walk able to all my favorite spots including Magazine Street, CafÃ© Du Monde, etc. And, due to its slightly off the beaten path location, it was cheap, quite and felt like a hidden gem. The unique, welcoming and very accommodating hospitality staff was like icing on a cake. Love this great find, and amazingly priced steal!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: medelsa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews we read on Trip Advisor and because of it's value. We were very pleased with our stay. The staff is very friendly, making it a point to say hello and greeting you with a smile or by your name. The free breakfast was also good. It was a nice selection of breads, "make-your-own" waffles, breakfast meats, cereal, yogurt, muffins, juices, tea and coffee. It was well stocked and neatly presented at a buffet bar. There is a parking fee, but very reasonable. Everything is pretty much in walking distance, we did not use our car at all during our stay. The room was clean, minor cosmetic issues, but overall a comfortable room. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, best value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CaptCanuck
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New Orleans recently with a couple of friends to experience the city, and as a regular user of TripAdvisor I decided to go with the Quality Inn & Suites. I didn't go in with any high expectations with regard to the facility itself, as it is a mid-tier hotel, but I was hoping that the service was as good as everyone said it would be.
