We were not disappointed. I have travelled all over the world and the service at this hotel was consistently some of the best I've ever experienced. Genuine warmth and interest from the staff, as well as attention to detail when called upon. My friends and I really appreciated it. The facility itself is basic, but the rooms are clean and comfortable, and it was very quiet. A hot breakfast is also included in the room rate, as is free WiFi - both of which we made plenty of use of. All in all, it represents a value that would be very hard to beat in New Orleans at double the price. If we return to NOLA, we will stay at the Quality Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: dawgbone98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last February (Superbowl weekend) and will stay there again. We went with a sports group to New Orleans and had a fantastic time. First and foremost, don't confuse the fantastic ratings this hotel gets with expectations of being pampered like you are paying $500/night. The entire appeal of this hotel is based on Service, Location and Value. You can't beat this hotel in any of these features in New Orleans. In terms of service, I've never met a more enthusiastic group of employees who want to do nothing but give the very best customer service. The people working the desk could have been swamped with a hundred people checking in at once and they are just as eager to help the next person or to recommend a spot to eat. The "continental" breakfast goes well beyond your standard bread and cereal breakfast. You will save at least $10/person/day on breakfast alone. If you have any issues in the room their response time is minutes, not hours. Location is just about perfect. Close enough to Bourbon street that you can walk there within a couple of minutes but far enough away (and tucked into a side street) to block out the noise when you do want to go to bed. We were there the night the Saints won the superbowl and even though the party was going on well past 5am, you wouldn't know it when you went to sleep. Value you just can't beat when you factor in the other 2. Our rate was about $100/night and that was about $30/night cheaper than any other hotel I could find near the same location. Without everything else, it's your standard Quality Inn, and if you go in expecting that you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: DHR1955
Reviews.Content: Just two blocks from the edge of the French Quarter. A quick 5 min walk. No need for a car. Room was nice and clean. Bathroom looked to have been recently remodeled. Good water pressure. Got a free upgrade to a small suite. Breakfast okay but certainly nothing fancy. Best part was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Must have interacted with 5 or 6 different staff members and they were all great. Helped us with advice, directions and the exchanging of bicycles we rented from a third party for the day. They were very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sabanized
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the most elegant hotel, this is not it. If you are looking for the cheapest, this is not it. If you are looking for the best combination of price, location, rooms, and staff the Quality Inn and Suites is a no brainer. A few blocks from the French Quarter, clean nice rooms, great price, and the staff is awesome. I stay here once a month and everyone that works here truly seems to enjoy their job. There is very little turnover, and for those that stay in hotels often, know that is rare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Natickwanderer
Reviews.Content: A old college friend met me in NOLA for a long weekend. Neither of us had been there before and we had a blast. We chose Quality Inn since it had such a high rating on Trip Advisor and were very pleased. The location was great--a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter, in the heart of the Central Business District , yet on a quiet street, and a couple of blocks from the trolley and bus lines. Everyone at the hotel was attentive and helpful, from making brunch reservations to suggesting a swamp tour. The rooms were very clean with tons of tv channels) and the lobby area was bright and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location great staff no Wonderful staff no awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: racquetpaugh
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for nicer people who go over the top to make sure you have what you need. When we arrived with 3 people he gave us a room with 2 bedrooms so we would be more comfortable, great upgrade. Hotel is 3 blocks from Bourbon st Thanks again to all the staff for a great trip Dave

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: boa999
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to Bourbon Steet and the French Quarter. The staff was very nice. The breakfast was average. Rooms were clean but the beds were lumpy due to mattress pads that had seen better days. Overall this hotel was a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Karabana
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the huge hot breakfast that made me rate this hotel excellent. Although the selection of waffles, grits, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, pastries, muffins (the chocolate ones are yumO), bagels, bread, cereals, fruit, yogurt, juices & of course, tea & coffee was certainly the most impressive I've seen yet at a value hotel. It wasn't even the no hassle complimentary King bed upgrade. You know how with most hotels you have to practically plead for an upgrade and staff act put out that they must consider this incredible favour? Not here, they don't have any of that negative front desk staff attitude at all! It was the truly friendly helpful staff that will always stand out in my mind. From the very first person to greet us, to all the front desk staff. We were always warmly greeted when we came into the lobby, & given many great suggestions. This is unique to any hotel we've stayed at.â˜º The hotel exceeded my expectations. I figured, it's New Orleans, they get a gazillion tourists, they must be sick of answering questions & recommending places, and we're no different than all the other tourists. Plus, the exterior pictures of this place don't necessarily say "Welcome". But don't judge a book by it's cover. The staff were completely welcoming. They treated us like we were special. I simply couldn't ask for more in a hotel. This kind of service is what I imagined famous southern hospitality is. You've raised the bar, Quality Inn & Suites (Downtown New Orleans).

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor is trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: gumbofile
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel a perfect score, but I have to concede that there are hotels closer to where you might want to be, with larger staffs, and free on-site parking, and bigger rooms. However, this hotel is only a block and a half from the Quarter (A block from the Roosevelt), and the parking is reasonable, and the staff and rooms and rates are great. As soon as we pulled to the curb we were met by a bellman who assisted us with our luggage. The manager then came out and showed me where to park. After I got in my car the bellman came out and offered to bring me to the parking garage. When we got into our room and I couldn't figure out the safe, a staff member was there in about two minutes to assist me. We left our car in the parking garage all weekend and walked everywhere we wanted to go, and when we got tired, the walk back was short, and at night it was quiet, because we were a block and a half from the Quarter. We could have easily spent two or three times as much (or even more) for a room, but I don't think we could've had a better experience. We spent our savings on great New Orleans food and drink. My wife was unimpressed when we arrived but now she wants to know when we can go back to the Quality Inn on O'Keefe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: krystle82
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel to stay in a quiet area, which was also a safe area. This location is good for anyone who wants to be a bit away from all the noise of the French Quarter area including Bourbon Street. It's just a few blocks away from the main area, but lots of things to see see and do during your walk! Very easy to walk from the hotel to Bourbon Street all the way to the French Market and Mississippi River !!! Upon arrival: We arrived at the hotel abot 3hrs earlier than check-in and the staff particularly Stanley was able to check us in early, and without any extra costs. He was very accomodating and upgraded us from a queen room to a king suite (again no extra cost). Staff: Very friendly and polite. Once again, Stanley was very helpful with any questions we had. He was able to recommend things to see/do in the area as well as provide us with a detailed map. The breastfast area staff was also very friendly and made sure to replenish all the foods. Thank Stanley for all your help and superior accomodations. We hope to see you soon again! Krystle & Travis - Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Thicket
Reviews.Content: This place has a good location for a cheaper prices of those smack in the middle of the French qtr. Rooms are basic but clean and satisfactory. This is a 'QualityInn' hotel so not not going to be the Hyatt so for what it is , where it is and the price, it's really not that bad. The staff really are helpful though. I would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: DandDTravelers
Reviews.Content: My daughter and granddaughter wanted to see Anne Rice's New Orleans, plus experience the French Quarter and the Gulf Coast (drove to Dauphin Island, AL, one day). The hotel is less than a five minute walk to the French Quarter and trolleys you can take to other parts of the city (it costs $1.25 per person one way or $5 for an all day pass). We had a car (valet parking is adjacent to the hotel) and drove to various places around town and the region each day. We did use the trolley one day (however, if you have the energy, it would almost be just as fast to walk down Canal Street to the waterfront than take the trolley). We felt safe in the area. The free breakfast provided a good start to each day - with make your own waffles, cereal, eggs, meat, fruit, yogurt, breads, coffee, and juice. Our room was clean and good size, with a small fridge and microwave. The room also had a safe, which was not working when we arrived. But Stanley, the GM, personally fixed it. He set the tone for service and friendliness for the staff, who all had smiles and were very helpful. Each was more than happy to talk with pride about their city, things to do and places to eat. (One of the soda machines dispensed a flavor different from what was depicted by the button; when I called the front desk, they not only said they would address the problem, but have a staff member bring me what I wanted. This is just a small example of the great service I encountered there.) While I used Choice Privileges points for the four nights we stayed there, I would have paid the going rate because of its location and service. Regarding the Internet - there is free wired service in the room (bring your own Ethernet cable or borrow a free one at the front desk when you check in); I understand there is wireless in the lobby, but I did not try it; I did use the computer and printer behind the front desk to print our boarding passes. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: wpooh27
Reviews.Content: we only stay for 2 nights,but would love to stay again. the service was great,could use wi fi in the rooms, the room size was prefect, the bed could have been pillow top, but we slept fine. parking was close by, breakfast was good,the room was very clean and seem to be updated. call the hotel itself and was able to get discount on room and parking. this was r first time in New Orleans and would love to come back for a longer visit. if you going to New Orleans a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ldesal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel....The staff was very friendly and accommodating....The location very good...1 block to Canal and 2 blocks to Bourbon St...The rooms were clean and the bed comfortable and the pillows were wonderful........If we come back to New Orleans, we will come back to this hotel.... Linda

Reviews.Title: “Among the best staff ever”
Reviews.Author: texascouple21
Reviews.Content: What a find. We arrived at the hotel while there was filmiing for a movie a few blocks away (The Green Lantern); the movie crew changed some street signs around the hotel so it was a little tricky to find but it was worth the effort. From check in to check out everyone we met went out of their way to make sure we had what we needed and their suggestions on restaurants was spot on no matter what our parameters. The breakfast was presented very well, fresh and clean--the hot food was hot, the cold was cold. The French Quarter was two short blocks to Canal, cross Canal and one down to Bourbon--close enough yet far enough away from the tumult. Safety along the walk was not an issue. Very nice room with microwave and refrigerator and more than enough towels in the bathroom--not the paper thin ones either. These folks have their act together.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: startrax25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location of hotel was great, just of Canal street, in the business district, so the area was nice and quiet at night time. The room was a good size with a double bed and a nice sized bathroom, the room was clean and quiet. The only issue we had was that we could not get the wifi to work but reception provided us with a lead and we just used that and the internet worked fine. The breakfast was nice and had a good selection to choose from and we never had a problem getting a table. All of the New Orleans attractions we found were walking distance including Bourbon Street and the Mississippi river. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans who wants to stay in a quieter hotel away from Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Beebs1280
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the money. You're only about 3 blocks from the corner of Bourbon and Canal. The rooms are more modern than most of the other "traditional" hotels you'll find around the French Quarter and is also a little larger than most from what I've heard. The service was incredible, I accidentally parked in the wrong garage the first night and the staff covered the difference as well as gave me a discount on their garage. They were also very polite and attentive to one small issue we had with the AC one day. The only issue we had was that the bed was a standard spring mattress but that was negligible compared to everything else. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Labeep
Reviews.Content: We had to spend a few days in New Orleans and we selected this hotel based on the reviews we read on this site. We have to say that the reviews were not wrong., we loved the hotel. It is located very close to the French Quarter (10 minutes from Bourbon street) but not too close to stay awake because of the partygoers (unless you are one of them and you donâ€™t care, of course â˜º ) . As soon as we arrived, we were upgraded to a nice suite, which was a good welcome. Our room was comfortable, clean and roomy. We had a coffee pot, cable, wi-fi and a safe . The bed was really comfortable. The staff was friendly, efficient and very professional and knowledgeable. They answered all our questions about the area and they made us feel home, especially the manager of the hotel. We had a 5 star attention for a budget price. Even when we had a problem with our rental car company ( we went to give the car back and they were closed), they allowed us to park in their lot for no charge. The only negative point for me was the breakfast, I did not like the eggs, I would have liked better quality. But the freshly made waffles were good â˜º This will be our choice when we go back to NOLA for a quick trip, thatâ€™s for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at budget price”
Reviews.Author: AlanP00le
Reviews.Content: Great location - friendly staff - ok rooms - passable breakfast (if you avoid the eggs) - I would certainly stay here again if I were to visit NOLA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Budget Price in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveyHUk
Reviews.Content: Do not be put off by the exterior. This is a great hotel in a superb location. One block from the French Quarter, less than 10 minutes walk to Bourbon Street and maybe 20 minutes walk to the Mississippi and in a very quiet area. The rooms are spotless, the beds so comfortable and the showers excellent. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The cups and plates are paper/polystyrene and the buffet breakfast could provide more choice. But the room rates are great value and I'd rather have that than fancy plates and menus. So glad we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jacomo
Reviews.Content: We recommend staying here if you're looking for outstaning customer service and freindliness combined with a very good value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near French Quarter, NOLA.”
Reviews.Author: TexansAlso
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The manager was extremely helpful in every way. If you have a car you need to park it in the adjacent garage. The hotel gives you a discount. You can easily walk to the French Quarter and the Mississippi River. No cabs to take! Breakfast was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Location , but that is about it.”
Reviews.Author: tenfootmidget
Reviews.Content: If you like a hard mattress and bad scrambled eggs this is the Hotel for you. Avoid unless it is $50 or under.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay at the Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wilrosmith
Reviews.Content: They far exceeded our expectations! As soon as we entered the hotel, the front desk clerks and day manager greeted us warmly. We arrived at the hotel several hours early to see if we could drop off our luggage. They gladly took them and asked for our cell phone numbers. They told us that we could check in early and would call us as soon as they finished cleaning the room. They even gave us a map of the area and directions to places of interest. They knew the area well. About an hour later, (still a couple of hours before our check in time) they called us to tell us the room was ready. And that our room was upgraded! Later that evening, we wanted to go out to "Mothers" restaurant. "Art", (one of the manager/clerks) not only showed us on our map where it was , but also showed us the safest route. He was very informative and helpful in too many ways to list. The next morning, we were greeted warmly by manager & staff, had a delicious breakfast and the manager even called a taxi for us. Wonderful experience. Only problem we had was the internet. We were on the 7th floor and couldn't connect. We had to go to the lobby area to connect. But all in all, the best hotel staff we have EVER dealt with. By the way, the rooms were comfortable also.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: arkansas
Reviews.Content: It's not the ritz carlton but neither are the rates. The service at the front desk is as good as any 5 star hotel I've ever stayed at. It's clean, convenient and just the nicest, accommodating people. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: abuelavoladora
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in reliance on TA reviews, which have been quite accurate in the past all over the world. Prepared for a charming, homey place, we immediately knew we had chosen badly when we saw exterior and lobby. Tacky and shabby. Maybe OK for a business traveler on a budget. Breakfast was dismal, with boxed cereal and some yoghurt. Bad location for anything but business. Manager was very nice and quite helpful. Internet was free and worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Super place”
Reviews.Author: boule
Reviews.Content: Very nice, super service very friendly and helpfull, comfortable room, good food, super location. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service from a medium priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puggy1128
Reviews.Content: We recently visited New Orleans at for the French Quarter Fest in April and had a wonderful time and a great stay at the Quality Inn & Suites on O'keefe St. Short walk to French Quarters, convenient to trollies and visits to Garden district, riverfront mall and six block walk to the new WWII museum. The staff at the Quality Inn always make it a joy to visit, they have a great full breakfast included and the rooms, while not fancy, are comfortable and serviceable with coffee maker, microwave, frig.in small kitchen area. Great for families on a small budget. Hotel needs some updating but for the money and friendly, helpful staff it can't be beat.. We went to the fest with a number of friends from our neighborhood and all that stayed at the Quality Inn were quiet satisfied with the rates and service. "Can't be beat for price and service"

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: fluffmcgruff
Reviews.Content: The manager here is friendly and very attentive. He remembers customers by their first names - makes you feel right at home! The staff is very friendly and professional as well. This hotel is very conveniently located to the St. Charles streetcar, Harrah's and the french Quarter. The room was very spacious compared to the small room in the upscale hotel I stayed at in the French Quarter for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for NOLA”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: We picked this because of TA erviews and the Quality Inn did what it says on the tin. It was easy to find with the help of a SatNav (GPS), We were able to park temporarily outside to check in and offload luggage. We then moved the car to the secure parking about 100m away which was a valet parking arrangement. We didn't move the car for 3 days but there were in/out privilages for $17 per day. It was a one block walk to Canal and another 2 blocks to Bourbon. Even at night the walk felt safe. We even walked past John Malkovich who was having a fag on the sidewalk outside the Roosvelt (that's a cigarette to you Americans and Malkovich's lawyers!). Room was a surprise. Not much bigger than an average hotel room it consisted of two separate bedrooms either side of a bathroom and wardrobe area with a fridge and microwave. One bedroow had no windows so was a bit dingy. However there were two TVs and we were very comfortable there for 3 days. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was good with bacon, eggs, waffles etc. Overall we were happy with the choice and in view of its location I think it's worthy of the TA rating.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harleyman48
Reviews.Content: We visit New Orleans at least once per month and have stayed at almost all of the major hotels there. Once we discovered this hotel we discovered our home away from home. Great location, as one can walk to all attractions, French Quarters, River Walk, Superdome, etc. The staff, beginning with Mr. Stanley' are the best. Never have we received customer service like we enjoy at this hotel. We travel very often and I must say a frequent traveler willl not be disappointed with this hotel. We have never had a bad experience at this hotel and we have stayed there numerous times. I can see why tripadvisor has it ranked #1. We will be down for the French Quarter Festival and Jazz Fest, and we will be staying at the best hotel in New Orleans, Quality Inn & Suites Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated? TA needs new category?”
Reviews.Author: Maryland2010
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to NOLA, and I was unpleasantly surprised by the Quality Inn. This isn't because the hotel was inadequate. Rather, it's because I chose the hotel based on TA's ranking system and expected something better. It isn't. On the plus side, it's reasonably well located, clean, has very friendly staff, and is well-priced. On the negative side, it is in desperate need of a make-over, the rugs are shabby, the rooms are dated, and it has almost no amentias. Also, the location is just off Canal Street in a very business-like district...no charm here. I think the problem must be in TA's rating system. I booked this hotel based on TA's recommendation, and I expected the #1 rated hotel in a city to be significantly above average. This isn't...it's just average at best. So, my recommendation to anyone thinking about this hotel is don't expect too much. It's a non-descript hotel in a non-descript part of the city that is reasonably priced. As for myself, if had known what the hotel was really like, I probably would have opted to spend more money on a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Orleans NCAA weekend”
Reviews.Author: UKat77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jewel. Mr. Stanley and his entire staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We arrived after almost a 10 hour drive, a bit early for check in and Mr. Stanley upgraded us to a King Suite which was delightful. The breakfast is well stocked, the rooms are clean and the location is FABULOUS. Close to the French Quarter, the New Orleans Arena and the street car lines. The staff is knowledgeable and gave us directions and suggestions of things to see and do. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting New Orleans. Truly a great economical but lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - quiet, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Travel7YYZ
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. Staff were friendly, and just next to the Roosevelt below Canal Street emant a walk to FQ and other areas. So convenient...but not in the thick of the sometimes loud craziness of the FQ. Free continental breakfast (well, American-style). Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jazmyne321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It is right in the middle of downtown, walking distance to all the major areas (french quarter, riverwalk, Harrah's casino, jackson square). We had first booked a room with a queen bed, but the front desk lady said that bed would be small, and automatically upgraded us to a king bed with no extra charge. She also gave us a discount for the parking garage. The room is nice, clean and neat. It has a nice little kitchen area too with a fridge and microwave. The exterior of the building looks old and it can deceive people from booking here, but don't let the outside fool you. The price is reasonable too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, accomodations overrated though”
Reviews.Author: chuckd21x
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews of this place I had pretty high expectations but I wonder if other people just have really low expectations. The staff and service was really great ( Art was super helpful and attentive). The room was ok, not the best ever by any stretch. I imagine the place gets pretty trashed during mardi gras which ended just two weeks prior to our arrival so that may have contributed to the dirty look and feel. The bed blanket had lots of obvious stains on it but the sheets and pillows looked clean. The parking situation was kind of a joke, $17/day and they leave your windows rolled down the whole time with the keys laying on the front seat. This unnerved me quite a bit needless to say.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best value and great service”
Reviews.Author: NorthWoodsWanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention in November. Less than half the cost of my convention hotel for a five block walk. Like so many others, I was given a free room upgrade on my arrival. I would agree with this being rated the #1 value for downtown New Orleans. Are there nicer hotels? Yes, but for your dollar this is a great place. Exterior is dated and unexceptional. Interior is clean. The place shows some wear at a few points, but overall very clean and comfortable. Room was fine and clean, and had a frig and microwave as well as internet and cable TV. Everything worked fine. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was pretty good as free breakfasts go, and there were always more substantial hot options like scrambled eggs, etc., not just pastries and cereal. Stanley, Art, and the rest of the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Got directions and advice, and they let me use their printer to print a boarding pass. Very impressive service. Easy walk to Canal Street, Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, and most conference hotels. Not too far to the Superdome either. With room rates typically under a hundred dollars, an incredibly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: tsainta
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean and adequate. Common areas not so well kept up. Extremely friendly staff. Great price/location combination. Fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: kmontor
Reviews.Content: As a frequent user of Trip Advisor ratings, I chose this hotel based on other reviews. I was delighted to find a property so close to my conference (one block) and at one half the rate of the conference hotel. When I called the hotel directly, I was greeted by an extremely friendly young woman and I really felt like they appreciated my considering their property. Over the next few months I called them a few times about a number of questions, and each time they provided an exceptional customer service experience. They even called me ahead of time to confirm the reservation. When I checked in with my wife, they welcomed us with a great big smile to their hotel, and even up-graded us to a suite at no additional charge. The suite was spotless, spacious, and had a very comfortable bed with extra pillows. During our week long stay at the hotel, we needed their help with recommendations for restaurants, sites to see, and transportation. Every recommendation for a restaurant resulted in a fantastic dining experience and we quickly learned we could trust their judgement. While the hotel is not a fancy one, it provides an amazing value for the rate charged and I can truly say the service exceeded hotels in which I have paid five times the rate. When I left, I truly felt that I had stayed with very special friends and my wife even gave them a big hug. Stanley, the General Manager, does an exceptional job bringing together fantastic staff and deserves much praise. I wish they could all be cloned and sent out to lots of other hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, not #1 hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: crazyAustin
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I was expecting (1) a very clean and well functioning hotel in a good location, (2) with a great breakfast and (3) friendly management. Well, 1 out of 3 ain't bad I guess, but it also doesn't make this the best hotel in New Orleans either. I wasn't sure whether to give the hotel two or three stars, but my experience overall wasn't good and I will not return there so I chose two stars. First things first, the owners and all the workers here are top notch and I can't say anything but good things about them. However, that is about the only thing going for this place. The location is two blocks from Canal and then two blocks from there to Bourbon Street. I didn't feel unsafe in anyway, so that was good. The outside of this building is hideously ugly, but that doesn't really bother me that much. The inside lobby is nice but nothing special, and they upgraded me to a corner room, which was like a suite with a living area, coffee area, bedroom, and bathroom. The views from the window were fine given the location. The heating works fine, which is normally not needed in New Orleans, but I surely needed it this time as it was in the 30's at night when I was there. However, that is where things fall apart. The window had a piece of duck tape holding it on, and there was a big crack in the single pane window that allowed a constant draft to come in. Fortunately, the heater worked fine enough to combat that draft. The bed itself was fine although the remote control didn't work for either TV's. Didn't bother me as I wasn't in the room much anyway. I was out partying late, as it was the first weekend of Mardi Gras and during the weekend of the Saints Superbowl. So, I slept in and took a shower at 11 AM. There was absolutely no hot water left at all. I put the shower to full hot and only lukewarm water came out. I took a shower as fast as I could. The next night, I didn't stay out as late, but I couldn't sleep because the Saints had won the Superbowl and people were hollering until 7AM in the morning. This didn't bother me as I was there to celebrate as well, just got burned out after two nights. The next morning I woke up at 9AM, mainly because I wanted to try the breakfast. The shower was nice and hot then, so maybe I beat the other people to the hot water that day? Now, onto the breakfast buffet. Based on the comments, I was expecting a grand ole spread, but I was sorely disappointed. There were no fruits except bananas and apples. The coffee and juice were good, and I needed that to nurse my hangover. The eggs and grits didn't appear to look that fresh so I just had cereal instead. I would have been better off going down Canal to IHOP (which is really close) than eating at this breakfast "buffet".

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: monkeyneck
Reviews.Content: The location is good, a few blocks from the quarter, so you don't have much noise when you want to sleep. Yet still within easy walking distance. Staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULDN'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE IN NEW ORLEANS.”
Reviews.Author: dare2burbest
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Australia by myself around USA over the new year period 09/10.. This hotel was just fantastic. I felt secure, safe and supported. The tariff was extremely reasonable give the time of year. The hotel is extemely well situated and rooms are clean and spacious and I was offered an upgrade at no extra cost. Breakfast was included which was great. The staff at this hotel cannot be praised enough and I appreciated the old fashion service without being smothered, this ensured my New Orleans experience exceeded even my high expectations. I will definately be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Within Walking Distance to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: AuroraCeleste
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this Quality Inn over NYE weekend, and it was a great choice. It is only two blocks away from Canal Street, at which point about you're only two blocks away from Bourbon Street. The free breakfast had all kinds of hot and cold options, and tea, coffee, and fruit juice is available all day (though they do shut down the juice machines at night). The beds are comfortable, the rooms are quiet, there's plenty of hot water and good water pressure in the showers, and the staff is helpful in providing directions to places that are beyond the map they give out. Two very minor things that wouldn't affect my decision to stay here again were that the toilet kept refilling the bowl because the seal wasn't tight enough in the tank, and the reception on the TV wasn't that great. But really, we weren't in the room long enough for these things to be a big deal, and they didn't negatively affect the trip at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: peggyedw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend and we were lucky to snag a reservation for the Sugar Bowl. Our room was upgraded at no extra charge and we were able to check in early. Our suite was clean, quite, spacious, the bed was very comfortable and THE PLUMBING WORKED! :-) The complimentary breakfast was great with eggs, bacon, waffles, etc. This hotel was very reasonable for the area and within walking distance of everything you'd want to do in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JCV07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to French Quarter, however about 2 blocks in the wrong direction. The immediate area around the hotel is basically a business district, unfortunately in some immediate areas its a slum -- abandoned buildings, shady bars, low-rent liquor stores, etc. Lobby, staff, breakfast area are all fine, in fact some members of the staff are excellent. Real downside of this hotel is actually a City of New Orleans problem -- road construction immediately outside the hotel; this included jack hammers and cement saws at 3AM. The staff did an excellent job of re-locating us, refunding our room for the night, and refunding all parking fees for the entire stay -- however if we ever return to New Orleans, we'll likely stay somewhere else. If not for the road construction this hotel would have been a fair deal for the price -- road construction really ruined it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth your money”
Reviews.Author: TRVLfrDC
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel for the following reasons: - great customer service - convenient location - clean - reasonably priced - comfortable and good size room - good breakfast! Prior to our trip and in reading the reviews, we knew the hotel is a good value. We were pleasantly surprise with our stay as it is so much more. It was priced in the lower range compared to other hotels near the french quarter but you get so much more for your money. The room/bed is very comfortable and the cleaning crew did a good job. The compimentary hot breakfast was a good start to the morning. The staff were always friendly and helpful and we also received a room upgrade when we checked in. Minor complaints: - bathroom did not have vent so to prevent fogging, we had to open the door - the room we got was close to washer/dryer and we sometimes hear the machines running

Reviews.Title: “best experience”
Reviews.Author: munna21977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good. First of all, good affordable price. The staff is so friendly that they help you in everything-upgrades of rooms, parking, directions to tourist places, conventions centers, restaurants, internet connection, keeping luggage safe, what else you want. I would say that in this country, I have never seen such helping and good staff anywhere in any hotel. No doubt this hotel is number one in New Orleans. Also it is pretty safe and walkable to all the important conference venues and tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay - Quality Inn & Suites lived up to its reputation!”
Reviews.Author: msj1819
Reviews.Content: I confess that I was hesitant to book this hotel since prior experience with Quality Inns did not lead me to expect actual quality, but I carefully read the TripAdvisor reviews and decided to take the plunge. I'm so glad I did! My husband and I, joined by two friends from Australia, enjoyed five terrific days and nights in New Orleans, based at the Quality Inn & Suites. We took a bus from the airport that deposited us less than 3 blocks from the hotel. The staff had selected rooms across the hall from each other and let us look at them before we checked in to make sure they were acceptable, which they were. (On the phone, they had said the room with two queen beds is small but it was much larger than they had described!) Everything - common areas, bathrooms, bedding, hallways - was quite clean and fresh smelling. The "continental breakfast" was extensive with eggs, grits, and waffles in addition to muffins, toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. The coffeemaker in the room created an acceptable brew too. The location was great - one or two blocks to the Canal Street and St. Charles streetcar lines and easy walking distance to all of the French Quarter. Every member of the staff we encountered was gracious, friendly and helpful. Directions and restaurant recommendations were cheerfully given. And the price just can't be beat! I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone who does not require fancy accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service, Best Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: I-Liked_It
Reviews.Content: We would never even consider another hotel the next time we visit the French Quarter of New Orleans. The manager was the most friendly, most knowledgeable and most customer-oriented I've ever met. Upgraded us to a suite without asking, early check-in was no problem, ready to provide all the information of what to see and do. The hotel is a little older, but well equipped with mini fridge, microwave and internet in the suite. Exercise room a little sparse and I don't think they offer a pool, but for the money this is a great deal. Best price on parking (charged by everyone) and only one block from Canal St. and three blocks from Bourbon St. Adequately safe area. Close enough to party, but far enough to get to sleep. 20 minute walk to Harrahs if you want to gamble. One of the better continental breakfasts with eggs, bacon, grits and waffles available.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl65
Reviews.Content: My first trip to New Orleans was made by Stanley and his staff. They were all very helpful and very good at giving directions. The hotel is very easy walk to the French Quarter, casino and the river. We arrived early and Stanley found us a suite for the same price of our Queen room. We are planning to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “I wont stay anywhere else when I go back to New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Pistol928
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn & Suites is #1 for good reason. My brother and I stayed here for 3 nights, Oct 22-24. We wont even entertain the idea of staying anywhere else when we return next year. Stanley, the General Manager, was outstanding! I booked my reservations through a travel web site, they web site stated that parking, $17 a day, would be comped by booking through them. Needless to say, It wasnt. I explained the situation to Stanley, and he said it wasn't a problem and he comped the parking anyway. When we needed directions to different places around New Orleans, Stanley was there! Not to be overlooked, his staff was outstanding as well, very friendly and nice. I could not have asked for better service from Stanley and his staff! The hotel itself does not look like much from the outside, but dont let the looks fool you. The inside of the hotel is nice and clean, as were the rooms. Although the bathroom was a little small, lets be honest, how much time do you actually spend in your hotel when your in New Orleans anyways! The hotel is also only 3 blocks from Bourbon St! The continental breakfast is perfect fare for starting your day, its actually more like a full breakfast buffet than a continental breakfast. Waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, cold cereal, coffee, tea, juice, pastries, assorted yogurt, etc. With that said, a big thumbs up to The Quality Inn & Suites, New Orleans LA. We will be back, count on it!!

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: johnmann404
Reviews.Content: We got off a cruise ship and got lost as a goose.We called the hotel for directions,and the girl at the counter guided us right to the hotel.In spite of the narrow and one-way stretts of New Orleans.That was a real plus. They allowed us to check in a few hours early and gave us an upgrade at no additional cost. Another plus. The staff was so friendly.They gave us accurate directions and reccomendtions . Gave us umbrellas when it started to rain cats and dogs. They were just real friendly people andthe hotel was nice and all within walking distance of the french quarter and at a reasonable rate to boot!! we will stay there next October.I would like to say thank you to the staff of the Quality Inn for a very comfortable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: SAshley96
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance Halloween weekend of 2009. We were saving money for our wedding so we didn't want to spend a lot of money but we wanted to be in/near the French Quarter. If you are in a similar situation this hotel is a good fit for you. However, just because it is the least expensive hotel within close proximity to the French Quarter does not make it the best value, just the cheapest. For a bit more money you can stay in a way nicer place but if you are counting pennies like us it will work. While it is on the edge of the French Quarter it is a pretty good hike to Jackson Square but you are walking through beautiful New Orleans so just wear a good pair of walking shoes. The rooms are very basic but everything seemed clean. The towels could use to be replaced. I have to agree that the service was very good. We didn't make any special requests but everyone we encountered was pleasant and eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable customer service!”
Reviews.Author: verysaucyme
Reviews.Content: I didn't catch the front desk receptionist's name but he was amazing! He let us check in early and even upgraded our queen room to a king when he saw that I was traveling with my rather tall boyfriend :) and even apologized for the room not being too roomy so he made our parking complimentary. He was so eager to suggest places to dine and where the great jazz music is performed. We had a fantastic stay! The customer service was really refreshing since we didn't get much great service from around that area. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Avid_Traveler73
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here and would stay again. Don't book a room expecting luxury as the hotel is older and on the shabby side. And when you book a small room, count on it being very small. But it's mostly clean, in a fine location, good breakfast and the employees are helpful. We opted for this hotel after reading reviews here and don't regret our decision as economizing on the room allowed us to spend more on fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: New_Mex
Reviews.Content: I had to go to New Orleans for a medical society conference and the room prices ranged from $150 to $300+/night. Plus all these fancy hotels have the irritating routine of charging around $16 for internet access. I got a room with a queen bed for $98 and on arrival they voluntarily upgraded my room to king stating that the queen rooms are relatively small and since I was spending a week there, they were trying to make my stay more pleasant. The staff was unassuming but very friendly and efficient, and they were genuinely trying to help and not pushing for tips. On check-in they handed me an internet cable free of charge at it was long enough to reach the important places in my room. The room was clean and the daily service impeccable (even though I don't leave tips). The shower was great, the towels clean and soft. There was an extremely quiet refrigerator in the room and a microwave. It took me 25 minutes to walk to the conference center but it was a pleasant walk and with a busy schedule that was my only exercise anyway. The front desk clerk also volunteered to book an airport shuttle for me. They also had a decent continental breakfast including some healthier fare too (eggs, fruit, milk, cereal, grits) besides the usual refined sugars. Overall I saved a bunch of money and did not regret it for a second.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 Reasons to Stay at Quality Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: settogo
Reviews.Content: 1. The People - led by Mr. Stanley, the staff here treat their customers very well indeed. We heard unhappy hotel tales from other convention goers, but our hotel was perfect. The staff are relentless in their pursuit of excellent customer service. 2. The Location - it's a short, safe walk to Canal St. (Trolley) and across to the French Quarter. The upside is you won't be kept awake at night by street noise. Some high end hotels handed out earplugs at check in that weekend. This location works! 3. Complimentary Breakfast - excellent as others have mentioned - fruit, waffles, eggs, beverages, cereals, bakery items, etc. 4. Advice - we received numerous good tips on restaurants from the staff and really enjoyed our visit. Our airport transportation was easily arranged through them as well. 5. Fast Elevators - we were there on a busy (Conventions/Saints game) weekend, the hotel was full, but we never waited for an elevator. 6. Comfy, Clean Rooms - ours was wonderful - spacious and kept very clean with great mattresses. 7. Quiet - even though the hotel was bustling, our sleep was uninterrupted by indoor noise. 8. Computer Access - while the hotel doesn't have a business centre, they will let you use a computer they have in the office. We printed our boarding passes, etc., that way and used the wired internet access provided in each room for our laptop. 9. Bathrooms - good sized, great showers, well stocked. 10. VALUE - YOU WILL NOT GET A VALUE LIKE THIS VERY OFTEN IN YOUR TRAVELS. We felt like geniuses! Thanks to all those reviewers who told their stories so we had the pleasure of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: billWingdaleNy
Reviews.Content: for an affordable, comfortable stay i would recommend this hotel,the staff make all the difference and though this is an older city hotel they went out of their way to accommodate us. i would recommend it to anyone and their comp breakfast included waffles and eggs, quite a suprise. great folk,great staythanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: The_Cottonmouth
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn is pretty much perfect for a stay in NOLA. The staff is great especially Mr. Art the night desk clerk. Nothing really fancy and no pool, but for the money exceptional. Clean rooms, fantastic staff, close to the Quarter and Mother's. Save your money on a room, stay here, and spend your cash out doing things. When we checked out the general manager shook our hands and said "I know that you are leaving, but if there is anything that we can do for you please feel free to let us know." They are awesome and really nice people. They have high speed internet in every room, but I didn't take my laptop. No problem, they will let you use their computer in the office. The breakfast in the morning is simple but perfect to get your day going. I would highly recommend this place to pretty much anyone. If you are looking for a deal and don't need an ornate marble floored hotel stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here, just as amazing as I remembered.”
Reviews.Author: deltdogg
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here since Hurricane Katrina. This hotel is fantastic. It is so much cheaper than all other comporable hotels. Our room was clean and smokefree. The beds were so comfortable and it's so nice to have a mini fridge and a sink and cabinet space. The free buffet breakfast is great and includes cereal, fruit, muffins, danishes, breads, and waffle makers. The staff is very attentive, hospitable, and professional. Though it is a little west of the french quarter, it is very convenient and centrally located. This is the only place I will stay in New Orleans. It should be noted that there is currently construction on the street in front of the hotel, but it is not a problem, just a minor eyesore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Isladreaming
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay!! DO NOT judge a book by it's cover. It is an older hotel and the outside shows it but once inside the door!! It is wonderful. The breakfast was great adn free which is always a plus but the room was great clean and the parking is very convienient.... which is a huge thing in NOLA.... I will def. be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great!! No 1 for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: WegWill
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay there - the staff is wonderful, the rooms are great, the location is perfect, breakfast is nice, couldn't have been better. Thanks, guys, you really made my weekend!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay”
Reviews.Author: HCB1899
Reviews.Content: We stayed here almost 4.5 years ago and stayed again over Labor Day weekend for 4-nights. It was just as we remembered. Very friendly staff. As other reviews state, easy walk to the French Quarter, a nice breakfast included, and clean rooms. It is not a 5-star hotel but we received 5-star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again- wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: stickypooh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading all the Tripadvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed. I went with a friend and we stayed one night. We originally booked a room with one queen bed (that was the only room available at the time), but we were upgraded to a suite, which is two small rooms (with a queen bed and TV in each) and a tiny tiny kitchenette and bathroom in the middle. Interior decoration, view etc was nothing special. We appreciated the free wired internet and free cable. Beds were comfortable and linens were clean. Breakfast was basic, but filling enough and I loved the waffles. =) It was about a 5 minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter. Parking (the garage was about half a block away) was given at a special rate ($14) and you could go in and out as you pleased. We checked out at 9:30 am the next morning, but were planning on leaving New Orleans at around 5 pm, and the manager let us leave the car there till then without extra charge. What I liked most was the friendly staff who were always trying to help you, and make your stay more comfortable. This is your basic clean "inn" - NOT where you come for romance or to get the feel of old New Orleans or a place to come just to relax at the hotel. But since we just wanted a place to sleep after we enjoyed New Orleans, this was a perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: fromdelmar
Reviews.Content: A very good alternative to the more upscale 4-star hotels. In addition to reasonable rates, you get free hot breakfast buffet, free internet, free local phone calls, reasonably priced garage (catty corner), a location that is a reasonable walking distance from the French Quarter and downtown attractions, and an excellent and friendly staff. This is an ideal place for a New Orleans visit, business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “No Wonder It's Number One”
Reviews.Author: glbetrkkr
Reviews.Content: I simply have to agree with the other reviewers of this hotel: it's simply great! It's a three-minute walk into the French Quarter and only three blocks from the St. Charles streetcar. Upon check-in, the desk agent even upgraded us from a one-queen size bed to two-double size beds. Breakfast is basic, but quite filling: tea, coffee, pastries, eggs, bread, bacon, grits and a waffle-making machine! The staff are quite helpful too in recommending restaurants and local sites. Will definitely return here next time I am in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Folks & Place”
Reviews.Author: Cajunstuff
Reviews.Content: Found this place last year for the Saints games after staying at the Hilton Garden Inn and paid 30 bucks for parking on Saturday night. Here it said 17.00 but they discounted it for me. Even let me stay parked until after the games I came to. It's not the prettiest looking building but the service from the staff is outstanding! For the money, I now stay for business. Comfortable rooms. It close to everything, a couple of blocks to Bourbon St. and 10 minutes to the Dome. The breakfast is good with fresh fruit and I love the waffles. If you're looking for romantic ambiance, spend the extra 100 bucks. This isn't the Sheraton like the last lady said, it's better! I like to get value for my buck and this place gives it hands down, pool or no pool. Friendly staff always.

Reviews.Title: “So dissappointed...”
Reviews.Author: mrsrorie
Reviews.Content: I really went back and forth on what hotel to book but the reviews on Traveladvisor definitely pushed me towards the Quality Inn & Suites. Here we go, I hope this helps... At first sight it's nothing special (this i expected due to reviews); the lobby was tiny and we didn't get an exceptionally nice welcome from the staff. After checking-in I looked up at my husband and I could tell he was just as dissappointed as I was. The elevator was dirty and the hallways needed to be vacuumed. The room was OK...the bathroom is small and I hate that the sink area is in the same area as the shower - not practical at all! The bed was hard and there's nothing to compliment about the bedding. I have to say, I was happy the room was clean and I was appreciative of the free internet and cable TV. My husband had the breakfast this morning and said the eggs were runny but the grits were good - again...nothing special. The location was wasn't bad, but we will definitely stay closer to Canal or Bourbon should we ever come back to NOLA. It's not too far of a walk to Canal or Bourbon but it is quite a long walk to the Riverwalk or Jackson Square. I think our vacation would have been better had we stayed somewhere else and I'm sad about that, but now I know not to simply go off reviews and go with my insticts instead. By the way my hasband and I are 28 and 30 yrs old (I always like to know that piece of info when I read reviews). Next time we will stay at The Sheraton or The Bourbon New Orleans! Please take my advice - if you're looking for a lush, romantic hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE! We walked into The Bourbon New Orleans last night and I could have cried - it was beautiful and the courtyard (pool area) was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely an awesome place to stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: jacy85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after reading reviews here. We weren't disappointed! Everything from check-in to check-out was great. The location is great - only a few blocks from the quarter, but easy to get to via car (we had a friend pick us up in his car several times). It was quiet - there were some large air conditioning trailers across the street due to some construction on some water pipes, but it created some great white noise my husband and I didn't mind at all. Check-in was great. The manager, Stanley, is a joy. We arrived at 9 am, way before check-in. They held our luggage for us so we could head out for breakfast and get a start on our vacation. Our room was ready around 11 am, well in advance of the 3 pm check-in time. The room was great. You're not getting anything ritzy here - if you want that, there are so many other hotels up on Canal St. that will be lavish. The room was clean and functional. There was a fridge and microwave, which was great the couple of times we brought left-overs back to the room. The bed was comfortable. It was a bit small, but for what we needed it for, it was ample. The breakfast is nice for what it is. We didn't eat there every day, but it was great, and I've had much worse at other hotels of this caliber. Staff and general service were great. Finally, check-out was fabulous. Check out is at 11, but our flight didn't leave until 3:30. We asked to keep our bags locked in the back, but Stanley let us check out late, for no charge. We would definitely stay here again - it was a great value, a great stay, and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the fuss is all about”
Reviews.Author: cardiffslim
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Staff were ok. Location was ok. Not sure where all the 5 star reviews come from. Our room was fine and pretty clean. The curtains didn't shut properly so we were woken up when the sun hit our room. Staff were pleasant without being amazing. They hung around at breakfast and were in the way at times. The guy on at nights was the nicest, although it was hard to get away at times! Location is alright and felt safe walking home from the quarter, it is also an easy walk from Amtrak station. All in all, nothing particularly wrong but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “as recommended”
Reviews.Author: John_ClarkPortishead
Reviews.Content: had two nights after reading reviews here. not a lot to add. for a newish hotel, a conversion from an office block, it has charmingly old fashioned staff including Mr George who was really helpful with baggage and parking. I felt very much in NO when the receptionist addressed me as " Mr John". . only a few yards form Canal Street with a helpful map from the hotel, you should not go wrong here. not surprized that it is so highly rated. Parking in multistorey a block away cost $14 a day. would have prefered the hotel to have its own space but the system worked well

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable, very friendly & helpful place. can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: shelialouisiana
Reviews.Content: i've never gone wrong with trip advisor & they didn't disappoint this time either. this hotel was comfortable & cozy. it was within walking distance of everything & was very safe area. very clean rooms. we booked a queen but they upgraded us to a corner king suite for no extra charge!!! very helpful with walking map & ideas about places we should check out. we had the best time in N.O. & can't wait to go back. loved this trip! thanks quality inn!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife0901
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Quality Inn in downtown New Orleans and were extremely pleased. The staff was very accommodating and friendly and went above and beyond with everything. The parking was reasonable and they also gave discount vouchers. The rooms were modern, clean and the beds were very comfortable! Our room was a little small but it was still ok for us. We also had a mini fridge and a kitchen sink. They also had hot breakfast from 6:30 am- 9:30 am. The location was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: piraatgent
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Quality Inn gave amazing service from the moment we checked in until we left. We had booked a queen and they upgraded us to a king for free. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of bourbon street and much more. The breakfast really hit the spot in the mornings. It was so nice to just walk downstairs and get such great food. It was like my little oasis in the French Quarter. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: llpick
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor, and the reviews did not let us down. A great value and the most incredibly friendly and help staff we have found in any hotel on our trip. The full breakfast was plentiful and tasty. The hotel was quiet, and just a block from the French quarter. If you are driving, make sure to ask about the secure parking available (for an extra fee) across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: stinkyfromva
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights, May 20-23. We had booked a queen room, but were upgraded to a king suite on arrival with no additional charge. Hotel was clean and nice, staff was friendly and very helpful. Free breakfast every morning which included scrambled eggs, bacon, grits, pastries, yogurt, cereal, cheese, waffles, coffee, juice, etc. The suite had a separate 'living room' area with a full couch and chair, also a kitchen area with a deep sink, refrigerator, and microwave oven. Only one block to Canal Street and the edge of the French Quarter, an easy walk to many great restaurants. Good value, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: lhda
Reviews.Content: I never expected anything as good as this.It was our very first trip away from Europe and i didn't know what to expect.I have to tell you now that none of the hotels i had ever been was as spacious, clean and comfortable as this one.The staff was amazing, extremely friendly and helpful.The location was absolutely perfect, just a breath away from the French Quarter. The breakfast was an absolutely wonderful surprise. I was used to continental breakfast consisting only of coffee, toast and marmalade but this was something else. It had EVERYTHING. Whenever i go back to New Orleans (and i will) i'll definitely stay in quality inn & suites downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottnjules
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is great.. if you want to experience downtown New Orleans. The rooms were nice and clean, the hotel lobby is comfortable, breakfasts were pretty decent, staff were friendly and helpful and overall we were very happy with staying at this place.. would definitely stay again if ever in New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Stay That I Have Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: kimandcyndi
Reviews.Content: The management and staff of this hotel give "customer service" a whole new meaning. From the person that took my initial reservation to the last person that we encountered when checking out, everyone exceeded our expectations! The hotel is so close to evereything and they even give you a walking map with instructions. The rooms were clean and offered plenty of space. The fact that they include a great breakfast is just added value. We would not even consider another hotel the next time that we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from all members of the staff”
Reviews.Author: juanivan
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Quality Inn and can not say enough about the service. The location is great, the rooms are very clean parking is close by, and it's a short walk to some great restaurants. Would recommend to family members and plan to stay for a week next year.

Reviews.Title: “Service +”
Reviews.Author: bamaman51
Reviews.Content: I, being a member of the working class, know what it means to get a "job well done" from bosses and clients. I want to give one to Mr. Stanley Mascair, CHA, General Manager and staff. I've stayed in hotels and motels before and the service was adequate to bad. Mr. Mascair treated my wife and I like we were the only people in his hotel. The rooms are nice, comfortable and clean. Convenient parking and close to all the main reasons you visit New Orleans. Even if it isn't the most convenient location for future visits, we will stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, by far, offers the best value accommodations in New Orleans. As others have said, Stanley goes out of his way to see that all guests are satisfied. His hotel reflects that in the quality of maintenance and housekeeping and the above-average breakfast each morning. There are a few things to be aware of, however. Some of the smaller rooms facing south lack normal windows. Instead the windows look into a narrow shaft way. If the hotel is full, you may unfortunately end up in such a room but Stanley will do his best to relocate you when a better room becomes available. You should also realize this hotel is in the Central Business District. While itâ€™s only a block from Canal Street itâ€™s very quiet here at night. The block from the hotel to Canal St. is University Place and itâ€™s far from collegiate. In fact itâ€™s primarily abandoned businesses, buildings and a few parking garages. Thereâ€™s also an abandoned theater, the door of which has been broken into. No telling what lurks inside. While itâ€™s fine during the daytime, walking back from the French Quarter late at night may not be all that advisable so you should factor the cost of a taxi into your hotel selection. Notwithstanding, this is an excellent choice. And speaking of choice, Choice Hotels runs this and thousands of other properties and you never know what to expect. Quality Inns range from abject dumps to this fine property so you need to choose carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: rags5930
Reviews.Content: We got into New Orleans late Wednesday afternoon, April 8th - had plans to stay for two days, but didn't have reservations anywhere. Well, through Hotels.com, we were able to book a room here for only $84 a night - what a steal! When we arrived, we were greeted by Blair, who takes the place of Mr. Stanley for the night shift. Well, talk about an AWESOME person!! He checked us in in record time, gave us a discount on parking, upgraded us from a king room to a king suite, gave us a map of the city showing us all of the "hot spots" and how to get everywhere, and helped us bring in our bags!! We went on up to our room, which was great - a very large, very clean suite, with everything we could ask for. The bed was very comfy, with tv's in both the living room area of the suite and the bedroom, and, since it was a corner room, we had two different views. After we rested and refreshed, it was back downstairs to talk with Blair - I tell you, he made us feel like we were old friends! He recommended two great places to eat - Dickie Brennan's Steakhouse, and the Acme Oyster House. We were going to do both in one night, but were so stuffed from the wonderful food at Dickie Brennan's, we couldn't eat another bite - so, we did Acme the second night - both restaurants were absolutely top-notch! The hotel was about a 4 - 5 block walk to the French Quarter, which is not bad at all - you could also take the streetcar down Canal Street to the French Quarter or the Riverwalk if you don't want to walk, but we enjoy walking and seeing all the sites. Blair also booked us on the "Rebirth of New Orleans" tour, which I would highly recommend to everyone - it is a fantastic tour to see the different parts of New Orleans, especially the 9th Ward. The private bus for the tour picks you up right from the lobby of the hotel - curbside service! Blair was a gem - he was so helpful, kind, and truly friendly - and so knowledgeable about New Orleans - he actually helped to make this trip great!! With the great prices for rooms, the awesome staff, the great location of the hotel, the wonderful breakfasts every morning, and the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms, it is no wonder that this hotel is rated #1 in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Stanley, Stanley, Stanley!”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: We're just coming back from a wonderful 3-night stay in New Orleans. From the moment we checked in, we were warmly welcomed by the staff and by the terrific day manager, Stanley. He and the front desk staff made sure of our comfort the entire stay and it addressed us by our names the entire time, which made our stay very personable. We checked in very early and when we were not initially happy with our view, Stanley got us into another room in minutes. Stanley offered us a free upgrade to a larger room the next day when one was available, but we decided that we were perfectly fine where we were. Free breakfast was a nice start to our mornings in New Orleans and the Quality Inn's location cannot be beat! We were within a few blocks of Canal Street, St. Charles Ave and Bourbon Street (and the French Quarter). We were also literally 2 blocks from the streetcar stops for St. Charles Ave and Canal Street. We didn't have to rent a car at all during our stay... cabs to/from the airport, walking through the French Quarter and streetcar to Magazine Street and City Park. We could not have picked a better hotel (especially at the price). Highly recommended for the excellent and accomodating staff and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: osugrl23
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn definitely exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and had plenty of towels. The clerk at the desk immediately gave us a walking map and marked her personal favorite places to eat on it. Parking is off site, but it just across the street. Parking was less than the website says and the hotel keeps your garage ticket so that you don't have to worry about losing it and then they charge the parking with the room so you don't have two separate charges. The hotel is in a pretty good location, not very far from Bourbon Street and the rest of the French Quarter. It's not a bad walk down to the River or to Harrah's. The hotel is just several blocks away from the area that I had read was shady, but our area seemed very safe. We walked around in the early morning all the way to later at night and felt safe. After around 10 or 11 pm, there aren't a lot of people out on the streets near the hotel, so I did take a cab at that time of night. There was street construction right outside of our room, but it wasn't very loud and definitely didn't disturb me while I slept in the morning. All of the staff members that I encountered were very friendly and helpful. The website advertises a fitness center, but there's not much there. Just a few cardio machines. There is a Subway attached (you can enter from inside the hotel) and a McDonald's not far away; other food options are within a 5 minute walk. The absolute best part of this hotel (besides the price) is the breakfast! It varied a bit per day, but essentially you had your choice of waffles, eggs, sausage, grits, fruit, muffins, pastry, yogurt. It was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “`I would advise anyone to stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanato3Northeast_Ms_
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours reading reviews on so many hotels before our trip. This was the one that really stood out with sooo many. We found it to be just as great. The location to the places we wanted to go was great, it was easy to walk. The street car was nearby, if needed. We took our 10 year old grandson to No for his first time. I was a little uneasy prior to arriving, but that was not a concern once we got there. We felt very safe,at the hotel as well as the area. The hotel was very clean & the room was very nice. We were not upgraded to a suite, as most had stated, but the room was fine, as we were out most of the time. They did put us on the eight floor because my grandson requested to be near the top. Mr. Stanley & the staff was all I had read also. They were very nice, friendly, & helpful. The free breakfast buffet was good and the price was excellent. I had a travel coupon and the room and parking was only $96.00, fantastic!!! I would advise anyone to stay there and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A little surprise in my old hometown”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: I am originally from New Orleans and have visited back frequently. My GF loves the city and enjoys returning as much as possible. I've stayed in many hotels in New Orleans and with many travels. This hotel is definitely a top notch place to stay. You get exactly what you expect and more. They upgraded my room to a suite for no extra charge and because it was available. The free breakfast was great and filling. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The location is right in the heart of downtown New Orleans. The hotel is also located more in the CBD area vs the French Quarters. We felt very safe at night walking to and from the hotel. I am definitely staying at this hotel again. It's very good to know and experiences hotels like this one. Last but not least, the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGoldie
Reviews.Content: The manager, Mr. Stanley and his complete staff went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our vacation. Great 5 star service. I was given great advice on restaurants and local sights. We were allowed to check in early, about noon and our room was changed on our second day to better fit our requirements. The hotel itself was basic, no antiques or courtyards , but very well maintained. Great location, walking distance to the French Quarter. The`area was safe for walking, even late at night. Decent breakfast buffet, hot eggs and sausage or bacon, fresh melon and fruit along with your standard pastries and waffles. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good value but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few days after Madi Gra and our room probably had some hard partying going on in it.The room was clean, but had the left over smell of throw up. The carpets need to be replaced often in these party hotels because parts were sticky. But , don't let us put you off - the location, price, nice people mean we will stay here(we're still in the room) again - just wanted to warn people that the place is a bit beat up oh, and the description is wrong, no restaurant, bar or room service - free continental breakfast in the am

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: flgrl76
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. First of all, when we tried to use one of the travel websites to book a room, it said there were no rooms. So we decided to call anyway and the girl we spoke to said there were some more expensive rooms available and that she would give us one for the lower price! Awesome! Then, we ended up arriving in N.O. about 8:00am in the morning! We thought, what are we going to do until our 3:00pm check in?? So we went inside and asked if they could do anything for us and the girl said she would at least secure our luggage and let us get parked and that she would work on a room for us. My husband went to park the car in the parking garage and by the time he got back she had a room available for us! It ended up being a room right by the elevator and we wondered if it would be a problem at night when noisy neighbors came in but I never heard anything. It was a great location...very close to everything we wanted to go to. We never once needed our car. The last day we had their continental breakfast which quite a good spread! I was impressed and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service! Fanastic Price ! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We read all of the reviews from Trip Advisor and decided that we would stay here. We were coming in town for the MardiGras Marathon. We booked our reservation on bookit.com and got a great rate! When we first arrived to the hotel I was a little disappointed, it seemed so far away from everything! I could not have been so wrong!!! If you walk two blocks over to the right you hit canal street, and from there you can get to all of the areas of the French Quarter. At first I was concerned about the walk to and from the hotel, but we went out EVERY night and it was safe, and well lit! We did not encounter any problems. The service at this hotel is reason enough to book a room here. They were the most helpful front desk staff I have ever met through my travels. We arrived early from the airport, and we were upgraded to a suite so that we could check in early - AT NO COST TO US!! Breakfast was amazing every morning, and they even offered to put breakfast out early for the runners of the race! Everyone was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean, although you can tell it is an older hotel, the rooms were spotless. The sheets were cleaned and the bathrooms were spotless. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the NOLA area. The location, staff, and price were fantastic!!!
