Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: holsgig26
Reviews.Content: Don't let the area steer you away!! We came in every night around 3 am without any problems!!! We met Mr. Art our first night and he is so friendly. Our room was a little to small for me, but not bad. It had all the basic amenities and then some in your room. Also Free Wi Fi, just ask for a cable. Everything was sparkling clean in our room, no problems at all our entire 5 day stay! No loud noises or problems. We made it to breakfast one morning. Its ok at best, but will hold you over. The beds were ok in comfort. Shower was awesome. Its a little walk to Bourbon, Cafe DuMonde and Harrahs. It is however close to the St. Charles streetcar. If you don't mind walking everything is between 8-20 minutes. Not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: j4ayers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, itâ€™s within walking distance of pretty much everything you'd want to visit in New Orleans. The desk staff and housekeepers are unbelievably helpful and friendly. They're a great resource for finding excellent places to eat and the best/safest places to tour. Although the rooms and hallways seem in need of an update everything was very clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were probably the best I've had at a Quality Inn and are a bit more extensive than the typical doughnut and cereal continental breakfasts you usually get.

Reviews.Title: “I would return in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: lookforadeal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a coworker who frequently travels. I wanted to find a place in New Orleans where I would not get taken for a ride. From the minute we arrived Mr. Art was wonderful, honest, and took the time to make recommendations. The hotel is a short walk to Bourbon Street via Canal and just also within walking distance to Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Great choise”
Reviews.Author: mn87504
Reviews.Content: Spent a full week there in November 2008. Great position, good breakfast, good rooms, very friendly personnel! Convenient parking in a garage across the street. Regards, Mika from Finland.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Miss Ireen, how can I help you?”
Reviews.Author: ireen1
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible experience. I'm a frequent traveller, not extremely demanding, but as I travel on my own,I like some personal contact, when I arrive in a hotel. This was it ! Upon arrival, coming from an exhausting sailing course in Key West, I was asked by the frontdesk, if I would like a free upgrade. I got a nice room with queensize bed, kitchenette and living room with a second tv. All that for not 100USD a night. Next morning, I was welcomed by Stanley Mascair, general manager at the frontdesk, with a nice : 'Goodmorning Miss Ireen, how can I help you?' I told him, I didn't come to New Orleans to only see the French Quarter, I wanted also to see the areas hit by Katharina. One of his helps hurried to get me a brochure and helped me make a good choice. I saw the 9th ward, in a small bus , with an excellent guide. I was knocked off my socks by the scale of the devastation and the grim future of the ones who lived here. But I'm glad I saw it with my own eyes. When I returned to the hotel, I was asked again, how it was, if they could do anything for me. I told about my big bag of laundry. No problem,we can take care of it or there is a washer and dryer on the sixth floor. For no money, I had all my laundy clean and dry.. Never forget Mr Baba, who came by as I was at the washer. I asked for a basket or big plastic bag. No worry, Baba will take care of that. He came back with two giant bags. I had no change, to give him a tip. He said: No worry, Baba is here to help you. Isn't this really nice! I was enchanted. This has become so rare in our world of chain hotels, where no one really cares. I told Mr Mascair about my satisfaction. He is in this business for ages and his aim is to tell everyone working for him, how inportant it is to make a guest feel at home. He and his staff gets from me a ***** ! If you travel to New Orleans, get there. It's only one block from Canal Street and the Streetcar. It's a quiet and friendly oasis! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a work trip”
Reviews.Author: giordano73
Reviews.Content: Dear potential Customers, I stayed at the Quality Inn and Suites Downtown New Orleans for 5 days in November 2008, and my experience was satisfactory. The place is convenient located to most of New Orleans attractions and businesses. It is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Provided breakfast was abundant and nice, even though the choice was limited. I stayed in a "queen room", which had a little kitchen corner (fridge, microwave, sink, and coffee machine). Far from allowing you proper cooking the kitchen corner comes handy for late/early breakfasts and those meals when you cannot be bothered with going to a restaurant (plenty of food stores open 24 hrs in the area). The separate living space in the room (sofa, armchair, coffee table and extra television) made the accommodation suitable for long working stays, which become uncomfortable in a pocky room. Finally, the main criticism: the price. I was charged $190 per night, excluding taxes, service charges, etc. It is frankly too much for the service that they provide, but if your company pays.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: CnsteFr
Reviews.Content: Very professional, friendly and helpful staff in this clean, all-comfort hotel. Had a great 5-day stay here and can recommend this hotel without hesitation. Although the downtown area is quiet at night, you're just 1 minute walk from Canal street which is always busy, and 5 minutes from the west side of Bourbon street in the French Quarter. Modern hotel with all the amenities though nothing very "New Orleans" about it. Not the best option if you're looking for local charm but otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and a Bargain, Too”
Reviews.Author: worldrunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn for 3 nights and it was excellent in every way! The reviews we read on TripAdvisor were accurate. Our room on the 3rd floor was nice and a good value for the price. The location was perfect - 2 blocks from the French Quarter and the streetcar line. The General Manager, Stanley Mascair, and Janell at the front desk, took care of us personally with info. about the city and recommendations and maps for sightseeing. The breakfast is very good and was more than just continental. There were eggs, sausage and grits in addition to the usual waffles, cereal, fruit, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KevinGil
Reviews.Content: What a great weekend. My wife and i met my cousin and his wife here for the weekend. When we arrived the was a nice gentleman that helped us with our luggage and where and how to park. When checking in at the front, what a wonderful experience, from the General Manager. His name is Mr Stanley. He was very helpful and knowledgable. Every time we came back to the hotel or down from our room, he made the point to call me by name and say hello. I dont know how he does it . We are looking forward to another long weekend in New Orleans, and we will be staying here again, it is like staying with family. Thanks again Mr Stanley, you and your staff are truly remarkable in this day and age of little or no customer service, yall are a welcome breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ridgeland_Dog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn and Suites for a week in September 2008 on business. The customer service at this hotel exceeded any I have received at any other Choice Hotel property (and I have stayed at hundreds). The folks working the front desk are incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and well kept. Upon checking in I was immediately upgraded to a suite without asking and at no extra charge. I would definitely stay at this property again and would recommend it to anyone. I paid $89 per night for a room and service that was easily worth double that.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent!!! : )”
Reviews.Author: kpnorton
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin...this motel was very impressive. I called last minute for a room for my 21st anniversary. Mr Stanley, the manager told me no problem and he set everything up. We got there about 6:30 that night. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean. The bed was comfortable. We were put in a suit it had a sitting room with tv. A kitchenet area, bath and private bedroom. When we walked into the motel you felt like you were with family. Everyone was very helpful. When we went to our room we had an aniversary card from the staff. It was so neat! The parking place was across the street. Had lots of parking spaces available. There isn't anything negative to say about this place. We can't wait till we can go back there again. I want to thank the management and staff for a great 21 anniversary!!!!! I will be adding pictures as soon as i figure out how!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover313
Reviews.Content: July 3-6, 2008 - The staff at this hotel made our stay a warm memory. We booked this hotel just a few days before our stay for a spontaneous trip to the Big Easy. All they had available were smoking rooms but we took it. When we arrived, I mentioned to the night manager that I would have rather have a non-smoking room. Even though the hotel was full he went through room after room until he found a way to rearrange getting us a non-smoking room for the first night. He said to see the day manager the next day for possible switching the other nights. The next am as soon as I gave the manger my name, he told me he was able to work some more switching and we could keep our non-smoking sweet room at the rate of a regular. The staff was amazing - always there with baggage help, driving directions and suggestions for sight seeing, making sure we were aware of the Fourth of July fireworks show at the river, making waffles for the guests at breakfast to saving waiting in line at the waffle maker- anything they could do to be helpful. We had a great stay and i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality Vs. price”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a nice location. Very close from the town action and from the street car stops. Breakfast was OK, taking into account that was included in the price (we've paid 80$/night). After staying the first night in a room just besides the elevator, on next day we were moved to a more distant room to avoid the elevator's noise. Stanley, as already mentioned, is very helpful and very friendly and the 5th point is entirely for him (otherwise I would have rated as a 4)! We'd definetely go back if we go again to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal95
Reviews.Content: I was considering relocating to NOLA so I was checking out the housing situation & stayed @ the Quality Inn for almost a week. The manager and staff were truly OUTSTANDING!! I had a king room, which had a kitchen area, consisting of a sink, small refrigerator & plenty of cupboard space. I would probably recommend the suites for 2+ people, because they are definitely larger but for 1 person, this was great! At one point during my stay, the A/C wasn't working properly in my room, and the manager offered to upgrade me to a suite for as long as necessary. The A/C was fixed w/in a few hours and I opted to go back to my room, so I wouldn't have to move all of my stuff. I actually enjoyed my stay here a lot better than some of the bigger name, pricier hotels, such as the Hilton Riverside & Homewood Suites. As for location, you are very close to Bourbon St., Canal St. as well as the street cars that run along Canal St. & St. Charles. The breakfast in the morning is limited but adequate. As someone who spent most of my time out, it was perfect to come back to a place where the staff knew my name & would call me on my cell phone if I needed any dinner or late night recommendations. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location - great service staff”
Reviews.Author: Wanderfool
Reviews.Content: Obviously, this motel is a great place. I just wanted to add that the front desk folks are the best I've ever encountered. We needed to store our luggage the morning of our check in and it was not a problem whatsoever. Mr. Stanley, as mentioned, is super friendly. The location isn't in a shady area as a previous poster claimed. We felt perfectly safe walking back from the Vampire tour we took in the French Quarter! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Safe Area”
Reviews.Author: EastofEngland
Reviews.Content: To contradict the last review, we are in our 60's and never felt unsafe in this area of New Orleans. It's a great location just minutes from the French Quarter and the main stopping place for the Streeet Car to the Garden District. We were lucky to get an upgrade from the very efficient manager (Stanley), he loves the Hornets! and he can also advise on eating places etc. Also all of the staff were effective and friendly and the rooms were very clean. he hotel advertises a Continental Breakfast, it's more than that, Bacon, Eggs, Waffeles, Yoghurt, frest Fruit, orange Coffee, etc. etc. it is very good. Only one slight problem, if the people in the next room have an early shower, you can hear the shower running.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in New Orleans on Wednesday 4/23/08 for the first weekend of Jazz Fest. As we drove up to the hotel we became a bit concerned. The hotel is located in the business district and it quiets down after 5pm. We walked in to be greeted by a very warm and helpful staff. Everyone was super helpful in helping us to navigate the city. Once we were settled in, we set out on foot to explore our surroundings. We walked a short distance up to Canal street where we found many shops and things to check out. The hotel is not in the middle of all the action, but for the money, you can't beat it. The walk is not bad at all. The parking deck is (diagonally) across the street. We parked our car and never got back in until time to leave. We were able to walk to the French Quarter and took the street car to the fair grounds. If you plan to spend your time out sight seeing and taking tours, this is a great hotel. However, if you plan to sit in your room and view the action from your hotel room, you will want to go with another hotel. Thanks again to the staff at Quality Inn. You guys are really great!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside, not so nice outside”
Reviews.Author: DannAconda44
Reviews.Content: Once you are inside, there isn't too much more you could ask for in a moderately priced hotel. The staff is great, the place is clean, and there's a fitness room (sort of). However, I cannot honestly say that I consider it to be located in a safe neighborhood. If you are coming to New Orleans, spend a few dollars extra and stay closer to the river (Sheraton, Hilton, Marriott, Harrah's, Doubletree, Ritz Carlton, Crowne Plaza, Westin, Wyndham, Holiday Inn, to name a few). This Quality Inn is unfortunately a few blocks off of Canal Street (a main road) and too far inland (where there are less people and not alot of action). The dark streets and shady characters can make a traveler a bit nervous at night. If you want the full experience (Bourbon Street, Decatur Street, Casino, River) the New Orleans Marriott or Sheraton is probably in the best location. The positives of this hotel are the price and the staff. When I arrived (on an airport shuttle.. which, by the way, avoid! just split a cab with someone), my room was not ready so I was upgraded to a suite (two bedrooms, bathroom, sink, fridge) for no charge. The staff was able to recommend places to eat and things to do, also. I would rate the staff a 5, the hotel itself a 4 (considering price), and the location is maybe a 1.5-2.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: caspyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the french quarter and a perfect base for exploring the surrouding area on foot. For the price, it is great value considering the location. Staff were very friendly, polite and a pleasure to deal with. The manager on duty was terrific and offered to upgrade us to a suite for no extra charge. He also gave us a discount on the parking fee ($14 a day). Our room was clean, spacious and had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and we had two TVs, a fridge, microwave and a safe. Full cable and wi-fi was also great. Breakfast was great and the staff were so nice that they kept the breakfast area open half an hour longer than usual. It included coffee, juice, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, bagels, grits, eggs and alternated between breakfast burritos or sausage biscuits. The breakfast area is large, clean and bright with a view of the street. We were overall very happy with our stay. For the price, you cant beat it in that area! The great staff, clean rooms and perfect location made our stay in New Orleans a pleasure. We'd stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: stepwallace420
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mardi Gras '08 and loved this hotel. One of our friends always stay here when in New Orleans, so he booked our room. We were able to easily walk throughout the entire French Quarter...it is in a great location and the entire hotel was very clean. The staff was super friendly and very helpful....always smiling (even during the hectic holiday)!!! I would definetly stay here again and suggest it others...great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: CopacabanaGrill
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the MLK Holiday and foud the hotel nice, clean, and resonable affordable. I paid around $80 per night over a holiday weekend. The rooms are not large but about meduim size as for hotel rooms. You get a large TV with cable (HBO), a desk, a fridge, and in some rooms a sofa. There is a 24-hour Walgreens one block away, on Canal Street, where you can buy grocieries for the microwave. If you are buying liquor, then you should take the St. Charles streetcar from downtown out to a Rite Aid were you can buy it for 1/2 the price they sell it in Downtown liquor stores and even more cheaper than the price in bars. The free breakfast was not very good. They have a waffle maker but only syrup for topping. Many Choice hotels now serve strawberry toppings, but not this hotel. THey provide microwavable bacon/sausage biscuits that are not tasty at all. But then again, it is free, and since there are so many places to eat in New Orleans at a decent rate it hardly matters. Even though the manager claimed that breakfast usually runs a little longer than than the announced ending time, I noticed that the housekeepers started putting things up exactly on the minute. In fact they were somewhat rude about it. Partly I think this is a result of the people (many from other countries, it seems) who now work in New Orleans hotels because native New Orleaneans have left since Katrina. In the past i am sure staying in the breakfast area after the official time would have been no problem, but things seem to have changed! The desk staff and management were top noch! They all spoke to you when you arrived at the hotel, but were quick about checking you in, and more than glad to help you with directions. The French Quarter is only 2 block from the hotel. For the price you will be happy to have stayed here. You get all the things you need in a comfortable setting. Save your money for the French Quarter by staying here. Plus the staff really act as if they are glad you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain with excellent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Ricpta
Reviews.Content: Spend 4 nights in January 2008- a bargain at the price. The front desk were all excellent. Great location with only a 10 minute walk to Bourbon Street. Highly recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 210 O'Keefe Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70112
